ChangedEntities.Title: Registration
ChangedEntities.Abstract: Take me to the Reg Line!
ChangedEntities.Description:
Take me to the Reg Line!

In case you arrive after Registration closes, go to the Security Office in Estrel Saal C to get your Badge.

ChangedEntities.Title: Fursuit Badge Pick-up and Printing
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: Pickup Only
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
Pick up your pre-ordered fursuit badges. Please remember to bring your fursuit's head for confirmation.

(Pre-ordered badges can also be picked up from the Security Office (as their opening hours allow) outside our service hours.)

**Tuesday is Pickup Only!**
ChangedEntities.Description:
Your personal fursuit badge is not only a nice souvenir for your character; it is also your
access key to enter the Fursuit Lounge when not wearing a fursuit. While you are in suit, you can always
enter the lounge. You do not need more than one badge, even if you have several suits.

Please make sure you already checked in at the Eurofurence Registration Desk before visiting the Fursuit Badge Desk during our service hours.
On Tuesday and Wednesday, our desk can be found just outside the room with the Registration Desk, in the entrance area to the Rotunda.
For the rest of the con, we'll be in Estrel Hall B, right next to Registration.

Since there have been cases in the past of people trying to get fursuit badges just to gain access to the fursuit lounge, we will have to ask you to bring the head of your fursuits along when you come to pick up your fursuit badges so we can compare them to the pictures on the badge.

If you pre-registered a fursuit badge, your first badge is free and you can use the fast lane for pickup. If you forgot to pre-register your badge in time, we can also produce your personal fursuit badge on site. For this service and all extra badges, we need to charge you a small fee of 2 Euro per badge.

### Service hours for pickup and printing

#### Entrance Rotunda

**Tuesday:** from when the Eurofurence Registration Desk opens – 19:00. Pickup only!
**Wednesday:** 12:00 – 18:00

#### Estrel Hall B

**Thursday:** 11:00 – 13:00 and 16:00 – 18:00
**Friday:** 11:00 – 14:00

Outside our own service hours you will also be able to pick up pre-ordered badges at the
Security Office (as their opening hours allow).

ChangedEntities.Title: Artists' Lounge
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: Let's be creative together!
ChangedEntities.Abstract: Do you like spending your evening around other artists, drawing and chatting about techniques, supplies and other topics? Then this daily social event is just the right place for you to be creative and get to know each other!
ChangedEntities.Description:
Do you like spending your evening around other artists, drawing and chatting about techniques, supplies and other topics? Then this daily social event is just the right place for you to be creative and get to know each other!

Come sit together with other artists and watch, chat, and have a good time together while being productive on your convention commissions. This is the perfect opportunity to use your time effectively, get critiques and help on your work from peers or simply relax from your work day at the Dealers' Den or Artist Alley.

ChangedEntities.Title: Fursuit Lounge
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
Like every year, EF has a dedicated Fursuit Lounge, intended for fursuiters only. It's mostly used as a changing room, but also to take a short rest, rehydrate, dry/clean/brush fursuits, or simply have a chat with fellow fursuiters.

Please check the conbook for the rules!
ChangedEntities.Description:
Time to wash the (sea's?) salty water off your face? Come and disembark at the
Fursuit Lounge and freshen up a bit!

Like every year, we've set up a safe haven for fursuiters (and their stewards)
to stretch their sea legs, where they can cool down, drink something other
than grog, and have a quick chat with the people they might not have seen in a
while… probably because they were out on raids along the coast again. Haven't
been there before, or want to know what's changed? Let us talk you
through what you can expect!

### Locations ###

Since some of our regulars were a bit too rowdy and lit half the nearby town
on fire in a drunken stupor a while ago, we've sadly had to relocate slightly
further down the coast. While you will still find the small treasure stash,
the mini lounge, at the same location in the lobby (more on this later), you
will now find our main lounge further north in the **ECC ROOM (2 &) 3**!

From the Estrel hotel lobby, go north past the mini lounge, **past the
checkerboard pattern** ("The Rotunda"), and **go down**. We suggest taking the
staircase on port side (left). Then go straight through the (mostly glass) wall and
**keep going straight until you reach the far wall** and, with it, your
destination! Please ignore any sirens that might try to lure you off course.

As always, in case you have any trouble finding your destination, simply
follow your nose…

### Services ###

While the past few years of being in hiding (not to mention the relocation… or
the reparations for that raided village…) have forced us to take a step back,
we will still do our usual best to tend to your every wish! Below you can find
a short summary of what you can expect:

#### Blowers And Dryers ####

Breezes aplenty! Please take a seat or a stand in front of our blowers to cool
off. If it's crowded, please keep some distance and share the
breeze. Likewise, please don't jump in front of people already using them from
slightly further away. For outfits, please (only) use the dryers instead! The
long tables of pipes are for drying heads (short stubs) and handpaws (longer
sticks), while the airborne pipes in wooden construction are for drying
bodysuits. Try not to keep your stuff on there too long, as space is limited
and demand is high. Otherwise we might need to move your things for you!

#### Drinks And Snacks ####

Feel free to try several of our brews! (Sorry, but local laws prohibit
alcohol, so no rum.) Please just make sure you deposit your cup in one of the trashcans
after, ok? We also try to provide some sugary and salty snacks, so you can leave
with more energy than you entered with!

#### Helpers ####

Our trusty staff is always happy to help you out! Whether it's getting in or
out of suit, grabbing a drink (we know it can be tricky with claws or hooves),
or answering questions, please feel free to ask us and we'll do our best to
get you what you need!

### Rules ###

To avoid getting in trouble with the locals (again…), we're afraid we need to
be a bit strict about a few things. Always a few privateers ruining it for
everyone else, am I right? Here goes:

- **Fursuiters Only**

  You are allowed to take 1 assistant with you, but please make sure that our
  bouncers can see you are together. If you want to get into the lounge while
  not in suit, you will be asked to show your **fursuit badge** (not your
  con badge!) to enter. **Please don't forget to bring it, and do not leave it
  inside!**

- **No Glass Is Allowed In The Fursuit Lounge**

  People come here to stretch their legs, not to cut them open on shards!
  Please drink your rum elsewhere. Eye glasses, monocles and spyglasses are
  obviously excluded.

- **No Blocking Of The Backs Of Fans**

  We know this is a popular and effective way of drying your gloves and head
  cloths, but please consider that all sweat that is being extracted this way
  is now being blown straight into the faces of anyone sitting on the other
  side.

- **No Photo Or Video Recording**

  People come here to relax, not to be wary of anyone taking record of their
  salt-crusted faces. If you want to take pictures, go elsewhere. No
  exceptions.

Please don't argue with our staff if they ask you to follow these simple
rules. If you ignore any of these rules, we might be required to move your
things for you, and we will not be responsible for you finding them again.

### Mini Lounge ###

As always, there is a small lounge with some basic services (mostly blowers
and water), in case you're afraid you won't reach the big fursuit lounge
before you run aground. You can find it between the Rotunda and the hotel
lobby. We may not always be there to assist you, but you're free to use what
is available to you there. The same rules apply, though!

ChangedEntities.Title: Summerboat Party
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
We’re back! It’s back! This year we begin boarding from the Estrel on August 23, 2022 at 19:00 and party all evening on our round trip through the rivers and canals of Berlin.

Our ship this year is newer, more modern and better equipped. Once again, we have a fully stocked bar with plenty of cider, a secure fursuit lounge with cooling, live DJs and a silent disco.

ChangedEntities.Description:
Do you like spending your evening around other artists, drawing and chatting about techniques, supplies and other topics? Then this daily social event is just the right place for you to be creative and get to know each other!

Come sit together with other artists and watch, chat, and have a good time together while being productive on your convention commissions. This is the perfect opportunity to use your time effectively, get critiques and help on your work from peers or simply relax from your work day at the Dealers' Den or Artist Alley.

ChangedEntities.Title: Artist Alley
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
If you're an artist, but applying for the Dealers' Den never crossed your mind, then the Artist Alley might be just the right place for you! No application necessary — if there's an empty table, feel free to sit down and offer your services.

**Once you are done, please free up your table.**
ChangedEntities.Description:
You're an artist, but didn't get a table at the Dealers' Den or simply decided that it is not for you? Then the Artist Alley might be just the right place for you! No application necessary — just grab a table: "First come, first served." Whenever there's an empty table, feel free to sit down and offer your services with sketches, badges, prints and a smile.

**Once you're done** doing business or feel like you've got enough commissions to fill some time, **please free up your table**, as another artist might be interested in having a go as well. Please also make sure to check bulletins for updated information.  If you download the Eurofurence smartphone app, you can publish "come find me" announcements on our Telegram and Dealers' Den Twitter channels. There's only one downside: due to German law, **selling adult material in public areas is strictly forbidden**.

ChangedEntities.Title: Art Show Setup & Check-In
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: Artists only!
ChangedEntities.Abstract: This year's Art Show once again features a multitude of international artists. Find your favorites, bid on whatever you like, and buy art for your home!
ChangedEntities.Description:
This year's Art Show once again features a multitude of international artists. Find your favorites, bid on whatever you like, and buy art for your home!

A separate registration is needed to obtain the bid stickers necessary for bidding.

You will get a final chance at bidding during the Art Show Closing. Here it will be determined who will make the final offer on a piece of art – or whether, perhaps, a contested piece goes to auction.

Important: the closing is a fast and decisive event. You will need to have bid stickers at hand to participate, so we can avoid crowding the show area with spectators. Bid stickers will only be available until 30 minutes before the closing. During the closing, we will not hand out new stickers, so make sure you have enough to place your final bids.

In the Art & Charity Auction, you will have to defend your selection of contested pieces against other prospective buyers. Please note that this year's auction starts earlier than in previous years.

Bids must be placed in Euro and paid in cash on site.

Look out for more information at the Art Show and read the bulletin boards for last-minute details!

ChangedEntities.Title: Opening Ceremony
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: Seating
ChangedEntities.Abstract: Join us as we turn every last landlubber into a seasoned sea dog! No matter if you're a just a rookie pirate or one who has already seen all seven seas – the teams of Eurofurence will brief you on how to sail this ship.
ChangedEntities.Description: Join us as we turn every last landlubber into a seasoned sea dog! No matter if you're a just a rookie pirate or one who has already seen all seven seas – the teams of Eurofurence will brief you on how to sail this ship. They will introduce you to our Guests of Honor and give you some tips for the upcoming voyage. We look forward to meeting you when it's time to set sail and embark on the adventurous journey to Tortuga.

ChangedEntities.Title: Fursuit Photoshoot Registration
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: Block 1
ChangedEntities.Abstract: Registration takes place at the ConOps Office (Estrel Hall B), first come, first served. Each block in the schedule has its own registration time; "Block 2" registration is only for "Block 2" openings! Once all slots for a block are taken, registration is closed again. So the "registration end time" is more of an "approximately up until" time. Due to the large demand for time slots, we prioritize people who didn't get a chance the year before. You can still apply, but you might get turned down.

Each block in the schedule has its own registration time; "Block 2" registration is only for "Block 2" openings! Once all slots for a block are taken, registration is closed again. So the "registration end time" is more of an "approximately up until" time. Due to the large demand for time slots, we prioritize people who didn't get a chance the year before. You can still apply, but you might get turned down.

ChangedEntities.Title: Your First Furry Convention
ChangedEntities.Abstract: Come here often? Or is this your first time at Eurofurence? So why not join this little shiny panel? Experience our security department and the famous Onkel Kage on stage! Here you get your questions answered in a furry way. Hear about all the things newbies always do wrong, but need to know in order to get the most of Eurofurence!
ChangedEntities.Description: Come here often? Or is this your first time at Eurofurence? So why not join this little shiny panel? Experience our security department and the famous Onkel Kage on stage! Here you get your questions answered in a furry way. Hear about all the things newbies always do wrong, but need to know in order to get the most of Eurofurence!

ChangedEntities.Title: Meet the Guests of Honor
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
As is tradition on our ship, the captain and his crew have once again chosen distinguished sailors from our community to set sail with us and share stories of their exploits with all aboard as our Guests of Honor.
So for this year's voyage, we are proud to be joined by Fox Amoore and JoJoe!
ChangedEntities.Description:
As is tradition on our ship, the captain and his crew have once again chosen distinguished sailors from our community to set sail with us and share their experience and stories of their exploits with all aboard as our Guests of Honor in panels and on various other occasions throughout the con!

So for this year's voyage, we are proud to be joined by Fox Amoore and JoJoe!

Both are famous across the Seven Seas, the former for his shanties and the latter for his canvas work, neither of which any decent pirate ship should sail without!

## Fox Amoore

If you've ever sailed on the Eurofurence before, chances are you will have already heard more than just one of the tracks composed, arranged, performed and/or recorded by Fox Amoore during our Pawpet Show or live at our Charity Concert (neither of which you should miss this year either). The Scottish artist going by the civil name of Ian James Armour has been a fixture on the fandom's nautical charts for multiple decades and, when not on stage or busy signing autographs and selling CDs in the Dealers' Den, is often found socializing with other attendees over a pint of a certain cold Irish dry stout.

## JoJoe (Jonas Jödicke)

Known for his paintings featuring majestic animals, the artist Jonas Jödicke aka JoJoe often features spiritual themes like variations on Yin and Yang in his artwork that has been featured online on well-known blogs (e.g. Bored Panda) and websites as well as offline in magazines (e.g. Forbes Magazine, Heartfulness Magazine) and on book covers. Hailing from our very own port of call, Berlin, his art can not only be appreciated, but also obtained worldwide, ranging from more conventional forms like shirts or stickers to new and creative shapes like escape puzzles.

ChangedEntities.Title: Furry Brew Crew: Beer Tasting
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: Bring Four Beers... Then Say Cheers!
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
Like a Snack Exchange, but with beer – we ask attending furs to **bring four
bottles/cans of a local beer** for us to sample and discuss.
ChangedEntities.Description: The rise of craft beer over the last 15 years has been phenomenal, resulting in the wide range of different styles available today. There are breweries all over the world, each producing locally brewed, unique beers. In this panel, we'll sample some of those beers and who knows: some furry brewers may bring some special beers of their own, too! Please bring four of the same beer from your area to participate.

ChangedEntities.Title: Cheese & Wine
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: Furry Mixer
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
This is the casual "Furry Mixer" meet-up! Talk to people you know, and meet and
get to know new people over a glass of wine and some cheese and crackers!
ChangedEntities.Description:
This is a furry "mixer" event: Say hello to old friends and new ones, and have a
bit of conversation! You are welcome to bring your favorite bottle of wine and
taste it with the others! And I, the Scottish Gryphon, will bring cheese and
crackers for you to nibble on! Everyone is welcome at this reception, in or out of
fursuit! Long straws will be provided.

ChangedEntities.Title: The Booty Bounce
ChangedEntities.Abstract: Eurofurence welcomes you back home Pirates! It's time to Yarr Harr and make your Booty Bounce.
ChangedEntities.Description:
After a long two years out on the seas you're finally back home. And you hauled in a lot of booty from all over the world. Time to make it bounce!

A selection of new and seasoned DJs with a great mix of music will cater to your needs tonight and the all new Club Stage with provide a perfect location for that.

Eurofurence welcomes all party animals back to its amazing dances!

ChangedEntities.Title: Artists' Lounge
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: Let's be creative together!
ChangedEntities.Abstract: Do you like spending your evening around other artists, drawing and chatting about techniques, supplies and other topics? Then this daily social event is just the right place for you to be creative and get to know each other!
ChangedEntities.Description:
Do you like spending your evening around other artists, drawing and chatting about techniques, supplies and other topics? Then this daily social event is just the right place for you to be creative and get to know each other!

Come sit together with other artists and watch, chat, and have a good time together while being productive on your convention commissions. This is the perfect opportunity to use your time effectively, get critiques and help on your work from peers or simply relax from your work day at the Dealers' Den or Artist Alley.

ChangedEntities.Title: Fursuit Lounge
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
Like every year, EF has a dedicated Fursuit Lounge, intended for fursuiters only. It's mostly used as a changing room, but also to take a short rest, rehydrate, dry/clean/brush fursuits, or simply have a chat with fellow fursuiters.

Please check the conbook for the rules!
ChangedEntities.Description:
Time to wash the (sea's?) salty water off your face? Come and disembark at the
Fursuit Lounge and freshen up a bit!

Like every year, we've set up a safe haven for fursuiters (and their stewards)
to stretch their sea legs, where they can cool down, drink something other
than grog, and have a quick chat with the people they might not have seen in a
while… probably because they were out on raids along the coast again. Haven't
been there before, or want to know what's changed? Let us talk you
through what you can expect!

### Locations ###

Since some of our regulars were a bit too rowdy and lit half the nearby town
on fire in a drunken stupor a while ago, we've sadly had to relocate slightly
further down the coast. While you will still find the small treasure stash,
the mini lounge, at the same location in the lobby (more on this later), you
will now find our main lounge further north in the **ECC ROOM (2 &) 3**!

From the Estrel hotel lobby, go north past the mini lounge, **past the
checkerboard pattern** ("The Rotunda"), and **go down**. We suggest taking the
staircase on port side (left). Then go straight through the (mostly glass) wall and
**keep going straight until you reach the far wall** and, with it, your
destination! Please ignore any sirens that might try to lure you off course.

As always, in case you have any trouble finding your destination, simply
follow your nose…

### Services ###

While the past few years of being in hiding (not to mention the relocation… or
the reparations for that raided village…) have forced us to take a step back,
we will still do our usual best to tend to your every wish! Below you can find
a short summary of what you can expect:

#### Blowers And Dryers ####

Breezes aplenty! Please take a seat or a stand in front of our blowers to cool
off. If it's crowded, please keep some distance and share the
breeze. Likewise, please don't jump in front of people already using them from
slightly further away. For outfits, please (only) use the dryers instead! The
long tables of pipes are for drying heads (short stubs) and handpaws (longer
sticks), while the airborne pipes in wooden construction are for drying
bodysuits. Try not to keep your stuff on there too long, as space is limited
and demand is high. Otherwise we might need to move your things for you!

#### Drinks And Snacks ####

Feel free to try several of our brews! (Sorry, but local laws prohibit
alcohol, so no rum.) Please just make sure you deposit your cup in one of the trashcans
after, ok? We also try to provide some sugary and salty snacks, so you can leave
with more energy than you entered with!

#### Helpers ####

Our trusty staff is always happy to help you out! Whether it's getting in or
out of suit, grabbing a drink (we know it can be tricky with claws or hooves),
or answering questions, please feel free to ask us and we'll do our best to
get you what you need!

### Rules ###

To avoid getting in trouble with the locals (again…), we're afraid we need to
be a bit strict about a few things. Always a few privateers ruining it for
everyone else, am I right? Here goes:

- **Fursuiters Only**

  You are allowed to take 1 assistant with you, but please make sure that our
  bouncers can see you are together. If you want to get into the lounge while
  not in suit, you will be asked to show your **fursuit badge** (not your
  con badge!) to enter. **Please don't forget to bring it, and do not leave it
  inside!**

- **No Glass Is Allowed In The Fursuit Lounge**

  People come here to stretch their legs, not to cut them open on shards!
  Please drink your rum elsewhere. Eye glasses, monocles and spyglasses are
  obviously excluded.

- **No Blocking Of The Backs Of Fans**

  We know this is a popular and effective way of drying your gloves and head
  cloths, but please consider that all sweat that is being extracted this way
  is now being blown straight into the faces of anyone sitting on the other
  side.

- **No Photo Or Video Recording**

  People come here to relax, not to be wary of anyone taking record of their
  salt-crusted faces. If you want to take pictures, go elsewhere. No
  exceptions.

Please don't argue with our staff if they ask you to follow these simple
rules. If you ignore any of these rules, we might be required to move your
things for you, and we will not be responsible for you finding them again.

### Mini Lounge ###

As always, there is a small lounge with some basic services (mostly blowers
and water), in case you're afraid you won't reach the big fursuit lounge
before you run aground. You can find it between the Rotunda and the hotel
lobby. We may not always be there to assist you, but you're free to use what
is available to you there. The same rules apply, though!

ChangedEntities.Title: Dealers' Den
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: Artist Setup
ChangedEntities.Abstract: In the Dealers' Den artists and dealers from all over the world sell all kinds of furry-related art, prints, sketches, books, comics, t-shirts and all different kinds of merchandise for your daily furry life.
ChangedEntities.Description:
In the Dealers' Den artists and dealers from all over the world sell all kinds of furry-related art, prints, sketches, books, comics, t-shirts and all different kinds of merchandise for your daily furry life. They also offer various other goods like fursuit partials, fursuit accessories, home-made treats, jewelry or they may have scoured the Seven Seas for great books and comics to bring to Eurofurence. Meet your favorite artist or just roam around and gather some inspiration from everything on display here.

Please note that some artists offer theme-related or Eurofurence-exclusive goods that you may not be able to obtain anywhere else. At our Eurofurence Shop you can get old EF shirts and other leftover goodies. Missed a design? Ask what sizes are still in stock.

ChangedEntities.Title: Art Show Setup
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: Artists only!
ChangedEntities.Abstract: This year's Art Show once again features a multitude of international artists. Find your favorites, bid on whatever you like, and buy art for your home!
ChangedEntities.Description:
This year's Art Show once again features a multitude of international artists. Find your favorites, bid on whatever you like, and buy art for your home!

A separate registration is needed to obtain the bid stickers necessary for bidding.

You will get a final chance at bidding during the Art Show Closing. Here it will be determined who will make the final offer on a piece of art – or whether, perhaps, a contested piece goes to auction.

Important: the closing is a fast and decisive event. You will need to have bid stickers at hand to participate, so we can avoid crowding the show area with spectators. Bid stickers will only be available until 30 minutes before the closing. During the closing, we will not hand out new stickers, so make sure you have enough to place your final bids.

In the Art & Charity Auction, you will have to defend your selection of contested pieces against other prospective buyers. Please note that this year's auction starts earlier than in previous years.

Bids must be placed in Euro and paid in cash on site.

Look out for more information at the Art Show and read the bulletin boards for last-minute details!

ChangedEntities.Title: Fursuit Photoshoot Registration
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: Block 2
ChangedEntities.Abstract: Registration takes place at the ConOps Office (Estrel Hall B), first come, first served. Each block in the schedule has its own registration time; "Block 2" registration is only for "Block 2" openings! Once all slots for a block are taken, registration is closed again. So the "registration end time" is more of an "approximately up until" time. Due to the large demand for time slots, we prioritize people who didn't get a chance the year before. You can still apply, but you might get turned down.

ChangedEntities.Title: Fursuit Badge Pick-up and Printing
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
Pick up your pre-ordered fursuit badges or get new ones made on site for a small fee. Please remember to bring your fursuit's head for confirmation.

(Pre-ordered badges can also be picked up from the Security Office (as their opening hours allow) outside our service hours.)
ChangedEntities.Description:
Your personal fursuit badge is not only a nice souvenir for your character; it is also your
access key to enter the Fursuit Lounge when not wearing a fursuit. While you are in suit, you can always
enter the lounge. You do not need more than one badge, even if you have several suits.

Please make sure you already checked in at the Eurofurence Registration Desk before visiting the Fursuit Badge Desk during our service hours.
On Tuesday and Wednesday, our desk can be found just outside the room with the Registration Desk, in the entrance area to the Rotunda.
For the rest of the con, we'll be in Estrel Hall B, right next to Registration.

Since there have been cases in the past of people trying to get fursuit badges just to gain access to the fursuit lounge, we will have to ask you to bring the head of your fursuits along when you come to pick up your fursuit badges so we can compare them to the pictures on the badge.

If you pre-registered a fursuit badge, your first badge is free and you can use the fast lane for pickup. If you forgot to pre-register your badge in time, we can also produce your personal fursuit badge on site. For this service and all extra badges, we need to charge you a small fee of 2 Euro per badge.

### Service hours for pickup and printing

#### Entrance Rotunda

**Tuesday:** from when the Eurofurence Registration Desk opens – 19:00. Pickup only!
**Wednesday:** 12:00 – 18:00

#### Estrel Hall B

**Thursday:** 11:00 – 13:00 and 16:00 – 18:00
**Friday:** 11:00 – 14:00

Outside our own service hours you will also be able to pick up pre-ordered badges at the
Security Office (as their opening hours allow).

ChangedEntities.Title: Meet the charity: Cheetah Preservation Foundation
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
Representing the Cheetah Preservation Foundation, Carmen and Craig journeyed all the way
from South Africa! The organization has worked tirelessly for over 28 years for the
conservation of dozens of species, focusing their efforts on the endangered cheetah. Come
and ask all of your curious questions!

ChangedEntities.Title: Fursuiting 101
ChangedEntities.Abstract: CANCELLED
ChangedEntities.Description:
The furry subculture is a growing community and so is the interest in fursuits.
The focus of this panel will be about fursuit performance and how to make your
fursuit experience the best and most memorable in your life! We want to give furry
newcomers and interested peeps the opportunity to get a first insight into how
your character in fursuit can be fully evolved. You'll be accompanied by lovely
guests with whom we'll show you that, starting with walking from A to B, you can
get so much more out of your performance than you think. Even if you just want to
see fursuiters go absolutely bonkers, you're just as welcome!

ChangedEntities.Title: Character Art in Video Games
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
Introduction to how video game characters are made by an AAA Character Artist.
Have you ever wondered how your favorite video game character came to be? I will walk you
through the entire process from concept art to game engine.
ChangedEntities.Description:
Have you ever wondered how your favorite video game character came to be? I will walk you
through the entire process from concept art to game engine. You'll  get an insight into
the day to day work of a professional character artist.
Including a Q&A session with me, a professional Character Artist.

ChangedEntities.Title: Fursuit Photoshoot
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: Block 2
ChangedEntities.Abstract: The Fursuit Photoshoot is run on a tight schedule. Please see the registration information in the "Fursuit Photoshoot Registration" event for details!
ChangedEntities.Description: The Fursuit Photoshoot is run on a tight schedule. Please see the registration information in the "Fursuit Photoshoot Registration" event for details!

ChangedEntities.Title: Onkel Kage's Charity Show
ChangedEntities.Abstract: Onkel Kage will probably be very intoxicated right after his Story Hour, so what better time to ask him to put on a charity performance? Bring along whatever money you can spare to support the Cheetah Preservation Foundation and you are certain to have a good time, especially since the old man may or may not be joined by a certain Noodle Dragon who is known for his side-job as a swimsuit model.

ChangedEntities.Title: Art that speaks from the soul
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: how my career has influenced my art
ChangedEntities.Abstract: In this panel I'll take you on a journey into my past — growing up in a cult, coming out and becoming a freelance artist.
ChangedEntities.Description: During the creative process, we often don't even notice that our subconscious is diligently involved and puts statements into our art that we only notice afterwards. When I look at my past works, I clearly see themes and symbols that fit each phase of my life. I grew up with the Mormons, among others, and it wasn't until I was 24 that I became aware of the inner constraints I was exposed to there. In this panel I'll take you on a journey into my past — growing up in a cult, coming out and becoming a freelance artist.

ChangedEntities.Title: How my disability learned to live with me
ChangedEntities.Abstract: I'll talk about my disability and how it affects my life. How I can stay positive and more…
ChangedEntities.Description:
A disability can be a huge burden and stigma. I can't walk, but it can't beat me down. This panel is about how to stay positive and live a good life.

In this panel I'll tell you about the hardships I have gone through and all the hope and good things I have found nevertheless. It hasn't been easy, but the fandom has been a big source of support for me. I want to tell my story and hope to inspire people a bit, and I'll also be open to your questions.

ChangedEntities.Title: Avali Meetup
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: Birb / Raptor thingy from spaceee
ChangedEntities.Abstract: A simple gathering place for the Avali fandom to talk, hang out, show off/showcase fursuits and art, and take a group photo.
ChangedEntities.Description: A simple gathering place for the Avali fandom to talk, hang out, show off/showcase fursuits and art, and take a group photo.

ChangedEntities.Title: Enter the Arena
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: Seating
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
Welcome to Enter the Arena!
The official annual Eurofurence Fursuit Dance Contest.
ChangedEntities.Description:
During a spectacular two-hour show, contestants from all over the world
compete to show their skills on the dance floor to a cheering audience.
Performances can vary from sensual belly dancing to contemporary
dance, hip hop, improv, original styles and even a mix of all of the above
combined. Each contestant's performance is judged by a jury
who will rate each contestant on style,
originality and overall performance.

Come and be blown away by dedicated and skilled dancers that have
mastered the art of popping and locking, tutting, contemporary dance,
mixed krumping with Krav Maga and Aztec Warfare. Or maybe they just know every
move from "Dance Central" and "Just Dance" by heart!

**Cheer them on as they… Enter the Arena.**

ChangedEntities.Title: The e621 Gameshow
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
How much do you know about e621? If the answer is "more than anyone should", then
why not prove it in The e621 Gameshow – guaranteed to be embarrassing whether you
win OR lose!
ChangedEntities.Description:
What's the most popular tag? Which artist is the most prolific? Which fandom is
the kinkiest? These questions have echoed in the halls of history, at least until
I was kicked out. Anyway, why not try and answer them in The e621 Gameshow!
Volunteer as a contestant or just enjoy being an innocent bystander, as we find
out – who is Eurofurence's biggest degenerate?

Warning: the hosts are not associated with e621 except in the shameful ways. They
are also not responsible for any mental scarring resulting from this panel or
their favorites lists. Also, we won't explicitly be showing porn, but, dude, it's
about e621, so. Yeah. Prepare yourself accordingly.

ChangedEntities.Title: Convention War Stories
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: So, you think it's easy to run one of these?
ChangedEntities.Abstract: Oh, god, kill us now.
ChangedEntities.Description: Have you ever wondered what goes on behind the scenes at a convention? Do you want to know why Onkel Kage drinks so much? Or why Cheetah is often seen curled up into a ball and crying under a table? The unfortunate souls who have been through horrors that defy imagination will tell you the answers to these and other burning questions!

ChangedEntities.Title: Dealers' Den & Art Show Party
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: Dealers, artists and staff only!
ChangedEntities.Abstract: PARTY! Dealers' Den and Art Show will hold their reception, where we open the doors between these two rooms for all the artists, dealers and staff members to get together, chat about art and other things over a beer or a glass of "tea".
ChangedEntities.Description: PARTY! Dealers' Den and Art Show will hold their reception, where we open the doors between these two rooms for all the artists, dealers and staff members to get together, chat about art and other things over a beer or a glass of "tea". You are invited to take a look around in the Dealers' Den and the Art Show at your leisure.

ChangedEntities.Title: Fursuit Lounge
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
Like every year, EF has a dedicated Fursuit Lounge, intended for fursuiters only. It's mostly used as a changing room, but also to take a short rest, rehydrate, dry/clean/brush fursuits, or simply have a chat with fellow fursuiters.

Please check the conbook for the rules!
ChangedEntities.Description:
Time to wash the (sea's?) salty water off your face? Come and disembark at the
Fursuit Lounge and freshen up a bit!

Like every year, we've set up a safe haven for fursuiters (and their stewards)
to stretch their sea legs, where they can cool down, drink something other
than grog, and have a quick chat with the people they might not have seen in a
while… probably because they were out on raids along the coast again. Haven't
been there before, or want to know what's changed? Let us talk you
through what you can expect!

### Locations ###

Since some of our regulars were a bit too rowdy and lit half the nearby town
on fire in a drunken stupor a while ago, we've sadly had to relocate slightly
further down the coast. While you will still find the small treasure stash,
the mini lounge, at the same location in the lobby (more on this later), you
will now find our main lounge further north in the **ECC ROOM (2 &) 3**!

From the Estrel hotel lobby, go north past the mini lounge, **past the
checkerboard pattern** ("The Rotunda"), and **go down**. We suggest taking the
staircase on port side (left). Then go straight through the (mostly glass) wall and
**keep going straight until you reach the far wall** and, with it, your
destination! Please ignore any sirens that might try to lure you off course.

As always, in case you have any trouble finding your destination, simply
follow your nose…

### Services ###

While the past few years of being in hiding (not to mention the relocation… or
the reparations for that raided village…) have forced us to take a step back,
we will still do our usual best to tend to your every wish! Below you can find
a short summary of what you can expect:

#### Blowers And Dryers ####

Breezes aplenty! Please take a seat or a stand in front of our blowers to cool
off. If it's crowded, please keep some distance and share the
breeze. Likewise, please don't jump in front of people already using them from
slightly further away. For outfits, please (only) use the dryers instead! The
long tables of pipes are for drying heads (short stubs) and handpaws (longer
sticks), while the airborne pipes in wooden construction are for drying
bodysuits. Try not to keep your stuff on there too long, as space is limited
and demand is high. Otherwise we might need to move your things for you!

#### Drinks And Snacks ####

Feel free to try several of our brews! (Sorry, but local laws prohibit
alcohol, so no rum.) Please just make sure you deposit your cup in one of the trashcans
after, ok? We also try to provide some sugary and salty snacks, so you can leave
with more energy than you entered with!

#### Helpers ####

Our trusty staff is always happy to help you out! Whether it's getting in or
out of suit, grabbing a drink (we know it can be tricky with claws or hooves),
or answering questions, please feel free to ask us and we'll do our best to
get you what you need!

### Rules ###

To avoid getting in trouble with the locals (again…), we're afraid we need to
be a bit strict about a few things. Always a few privateers ruining it for
everyone else, am I right? Here goes:

- **Fursuiters Only**

  You are allowed to take 1 assistant with you, but please make sure that our
  bouncers can see you are together. If you want to get into the lounge while
  not in suit, you will be asked to show your **fursuit badge** (not your
  con badge!) to enter. **Please don't forget to bring it, and do not leave it
  inside!**

- **No Glass Is Allowed In The Fursuit Lounge**

  People come here to stretch their legs, not to cut them open on shards!
  Please drink your rum elsewhere. Eye glasses, monocles and spyglasses are
  obviously excluded.

- **No Blocking Of The Backs Of Fans**

  We know this is a popular and effective way of drying your gloves and head
  cloths, but please consider that all sweat that is being extracted this way
  is now being blown straight into the faces of anyone sitting on the other
  side.

- **No Photo Or Video Recording**

  People come here to relax, not to be wary of anyone taking record of their
  salt-crusted faces. If you want to take pictures, go elsewhere. No
  exceptions.

Please don't argue with our staff if they ask you to follow these simple
rules. If you ignore any of these rules, we might be required to move your
things for you, and we will not be responsible for you finding them again.

### Mini Lounge ###

As always, there is a small lounge with some basic services (mostly blowers
and water), in case you're afraid you won't reach the big fursuit lounge
before you run aground. You can find it between the Rotunda and the hotel
lobby. We may not always be there to assist you, but you're free to use what
is available to you there. The same rules apply, though!

ChangedEntities.Title: The Pirate's Paradise
ChangedEntities.Abstract: This is Eurofurence's Club Night. We don't hold back. Neither should you. It's time to party.
ChangedEntities.Description:
The Pirate's Paradise brings you what every sea dog needs. Loud thumping beats from the bass cannon and shining bright lights in the sky. 

The Eurofurence Club Night not only pulled all strings to get the chairman himself behind the decks, it's also gonna blow your mind with a wide selection of music and a stage unlike anything you've ever seen. Ready for a ride? Welcome to the Paradise!

ChangedEntities.Title: Fur-E-Oke
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: Open End
ChangedEntities.Abstract: Sing your heart out to your favorite tunes, melt the hearts of the audience with your velvet voice, or rock their socks off! You decide!
ChangedEntities.Description:
Sing your heart out to your favorite tunes, melt the hearts of the audience with your velvet voice, or rock their socks off! You decide!

Open End!

ChangedEntities.Title: THE EUROFURENCE ULTIMATE MEGA PUB QUIZ
ChangedEntities.Abstract: WHOA! This is the ULTIMATE EUROFURENCE MEGA PUB QUIZ! Can you make a team of 4 – 6 people? Can you come up with a powerful and fearsome team name? Do you have what it takes to win the ULTIMATE EUROFURENCE MEGA PUB QUIZ? A maximum of 20 teams will be allowed to participate, so it's first come, first served!
ChangedEntities.Description: WHOA! This is the ULTIMATE EUROFURENCE MEGA PUB QUIZ! Can you make a team of 4 – 6 people? Can you come up with a powerful and fearsome team name? Do you have what it takes to win the ULTIMATE EUROFURENCE MEGA PUB QUIZ? A maximum of 20 teams will be allowed to participate, so it's first come, first served!

ChangedEntities.Title: Macro/Micro Meet
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
No matter if you are giant or tiny or just interested in looking at Kaijus, you should
take a peek at the Macro/Micro Meet.
ChangedEntities.Description:
No matter if you are giant or tiny or just interested in looking at Kaijus, you should
take a peek at the Macro/Micro Meet. Just be careful where you're stepping, or standing for
that matter. The Macro/Micro Meet offers you the opportunity to hang out with like-minded
people in a relaxing atmosphere. Take a seat and enjoy watching our Macrosuiters posing
and stomping through our little city with freshly shrunk buildings and vehicles. Kick back
and chat about all the exciting and fascinating topics concerning the
Macro/Micro world. We're looking forward to your visit, and remember: look out when you
take a step, lest you step on someone, or get stepped on!

ChangedEntities.Title: How Could We Organize In The Furry Fandom?
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
Current events are stressful, and we could all use a
break. But what constructive things could the furry fandom offer us in such trying times?
In this newly updated and illustrated talk, we explore what makes furry special, what we
can currently do to make a difference in today's world, and what exciting and hopeful
futures we may build thanks to the best parts of the fandom.
ChangedEntities.Description:
The latest fully illustrated talk from Jonathan Vair Duncan and Sasha R.
Jones. We will review the strengths of the furry fandom and what makes it unique from
other fandoms and online communities, and then talk about the ways in which it is and is
not currently prepared to meet the needs of furries going forward in our changing world.
How can we use our current strengths to better meet peoples' needs, and to create
resiliency so that we may enjoy the fandom for decades to come? We will balance humor and
earnest sincerity to make these conversations easier for people to engage with, and to
empower them to feel capable of navigating the future. We will introduce topics such as
mutual aid and in-person community building and open the discussion to how these support
networks could interface with the furry fandom as an international community.
ChangedEntities.PanelHosts: Jonathan Vair Duncan, Sasha R. Jones

ChangedEntities.Title: Artists' Lounge
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: Let's be creative together!
ChangedEntities.Abstract: Do you like spending your evening around other artists, drawing and chatting about techniques, supplies and other topics? Then this daily social event is just the right place for you to be creative and get to know each other!
ChangedEntities.Description:
Do you like spending your evening around other artists, drawing and chatting about techniques, supplies and other topics? Then this daily social event is just the right place for you to be creative and get to know each other!

Come sit together with other artists and watch, chat, and have a good time together while being productive on your convention commissions. This is the perfect opportunity to use your time effectively, get critiques and help on your work from peers or simply relax from your work day at the Dealers' Den or Artist Alley.

Like every year, EF has a dedicated Fursuit Lounge, intended for fursuiters only. It's mostly used as a changing room, but also to take a short rest, rehydrate, dry/clean/brush fursuits, or simply have a chat with fellow fursuiters.

Please check the conbook for the rules!

ChangedEntities.Title: Fursuit Photoshoot Registration
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: Block 4
ChangedEntities.Abstract: Registration takes place at the ConOps Office (Estrel Hall B), first come, first served. Each block in the schedule has its own registration time; "Block 2" registration is only for "Block 2" openings! Once all slots for a block are taken, registration is closed again. So the "registration end time" is more of an "approximately up until" time. Due to the large demand for time slots, we prioritize people who didn't get a chance the year before. You can still apply, but you might get turned down.

ChangedEntities.Title: Dealers' Den
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: Artist Setup
ChangedEntities.Abstract: In the Dealers' Den artists and dealers from all over the world sell all kinds of furry-related art, prints, sketches, books, comics, t-shirts and all different kinds of merchandise for your daily furry life.
ChangedEntities.Description:
In the Dealers' Den artists and dealers from all over the world sell all kinds of furry-related art, prints, sketches, books, comics, t-shirts and all different kinds of merchandise for your daily furry life. They also offer various other goods like fursuit partials, fursuit accessories, home-made treats, jewelry or they may have scoured the Seven Seas for great books and comics to bring to Eurofurence. Meet your favorite artist or just roam around and gather some inspiration from everything on display here.

Please note that some artists offer theme-related or Eurofurence-exclusive goods that you may not be able to obtain anywhere else. At our Eurofurence Shop you can get old EF shirts and other leftover goodies. Missed a design? Ask what sizes are still in stock.

ChangedEntities.Title: Fursuit Badge Pick-up and Printing
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
Pick up your pre-ordered fursuit badges or get new ones made on site for a small fee. Please remember to bring your fursuit's head for confirmation.

(Pre-ordered badges can also be picked up from the Security Office (as their opening hours allow) outside our service hours.)
ChangedEntities.Description:
Your personal fursuit badge is not only a nice souvenir for your character; it is also your
access key to enter the Fursuit Lounge when not wearing a fursuit. While you are in suit, you can always
enter the lounge. You do not need more than one badge, even if you have several suits.

Please make sure you already checked in at the Eurofurence Registration Desk before visiting the Fursuit Badge Desk during our service hours.
On Tuesday and Wednesday, our desk can be found just outside the room with the Registration Desk, in the entrance area to the Rotunda.
For the rest of the con, we'll be in Estrel Hall B, right next to Registration.

Since there have been cases in the past of people trying to get fursuit badges just to gain access to the fursuit lounge, we will have to ask you to bring the head of your fursuits along when you come to pick up your fursuit badges so we can compare them to the pictures on the badge.

If you pre-registered a fursuit badge, your first badge is free and you can use the fast lane for pickup. If you forgot to pre-register your badge in time, we can also produce your personal fursuit badge on site. For this service and all extra badges, we need to charge you a small fee of 2 Euro per badge.

### Service hours for pickup and printing

#### Entrance Rotunda

**Tuesday:** from when the Eurofurence Registration Desk opens – 19:00. Pickup only!
**Wednesday:** 12:00 – 18:00

#### Estrel Hall B

**Thursday:** 11:00 – 13:00 and 16:00 – 18:00
**Friday:** 11:00 – 14:00

Outside our own service hours you will also be able to pick up pre-ordered badges at the
Security Office (as their opening hours allow).

ChangedEntities.Title: Registration
ChangedEntities.Abstract: Take me to the Reg Line!
ChangedEntities.Description: Take me to the Reg Line!

ChangedEntities.Title: Art Show
ChangedEntities.Abstract: This year's Art Show once again features a multitude of international artists. Find your favorites, bid on whatever you like, and buy art for your home!
ChangedEntities.Description:
This year's Art Show once again features a multitude of international artists. Find your favorites, bid on whatever you like, and buy art for your home!

A separate registration is needed to obtain the bid stickers necessary for bidding.

You will get a final chance at bidding during the Art Show Closing. Here it will be determined who will make the final offer on a piece of art – or whether, perhaps, a contested piece goes to auction.

Important: the closing is a fast and decisive event. You will need to have bid stickers at hand to participate, so we can avoid crowding the show area with spectators. Bid stickers will only be available until 30 minutes before the closing. During the closing, we will not hand out new stickers, so make sure you have enough to place your final bids.

In the Art & Charity Auction, you will have to defend your selection of contested pieces against other prospective buyers. Please note that this year's auction starts earlier than in previous years.

Bids must be placed in Euro and paid in cash on site.

Look out for more information at the Art Show and read the bulletin boards for last-minute details!

ChangedEntities.Title: Fursuit Photoshoot
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: Block 3
ChangedEntities.Abstract: The Fursuit Photoshoot is run on a tight schedule. Please see the registration information in the "Fursuit Photoshoot Registration" event for details!
ChangedEntities.Description: The Fursuit Photoshoot is run on a tight schedule. Please see the registration information in the "Fursuit Photoshoot Registration" event for details!

ChangedEntities.Title: Enlightenment on Health Topics with the Berliner Aids-Hilfe e.V.
ChangedEntities.Abstract: We're talking about sexually transmitted infections (STI for short) and it's not only about HIV and AIDS, it's about much more. Because it's important to be well informed about this topic, we invited the Berliner Aids-Hilfe e.V. to do their information work at Eurofurence.
ChangedEntities.Description: The topic is omnipresent in our society general, but also in the ever-growing furry fandom. It affects numerous people, directly or indirectly. The Berliner Aids-Hilfe e.V. have a dedicated room at the Estrel Hotel, but will also be present in the open hotel lobby and foyer area with an information desk. So don't hesitate to speak with them or visit their room if you wish for a more private conversation.

ChangedEntities.Title: Artist Alley
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
If you're an artist, but applying for the Dealers' Den never crossed your mind, then the Artist Alley might be just the right place for you! No application necessary — if there's an empty table, feel free to sit down and offer your services.

**Once you are done, please free up your table.**
ChangedEntities.Description:
You're an artist, but didn't get a table at the Dealers' Den or simply decided that it is not for you? Then the Artist Alley might be just the right place for you! No application necessary — just grab a table: "First come, first served." Whenever there's an empty table, feel free to sit down and offer your services with sketches, badges, prints and a smile.

**Once you're done** doing business or feel like you've got enough commissions to fill some time, **please free up your table**, as another artist might be interested in having a go as well. Please also make sure to check bulletins for updated information.  If you download the Eurofurence smartphone app, you can publish "come find me" announcements on our Telegram and Dealers' Den Twitter channels. There's only one downside: due to German law, **selling adult material in public areas is strictly forbidden**.

ChangedEntities.Title: Zoological facilities: Myths & Missions
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
Zoological facilities are a magical place where you can see and meet animals from all
around the globe; but they can also give the impression of a prison for wildlife built for
profit. But what is myth, and what is fact? Join Craig from the CPF, and get your
questions addressed.
ChangedEntities.Description:
Zoological facilities are a magical place where you can see and meet animals from all
around the globe; but they can also give the impression of a prison for wildlife built for
profit.
What is myth and what is reality in those perceptions?
What is the purpose and importance of those facilities?
How do they ensure the mental and physical well-being of wild animals in captivity?
Join Craig from CPF as he addresses all those questions and more!

ChangedEntities.Title: Effective Writing
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: How to make a story come to life
ChangedEntities.Abstract: Onkel Kage teaches the elements of a good story and how to write in such a way as to bring the story to life in the reader's mind.
ChangedEntities.Description: Onkel Kage not only tells stories on stage, but he has been writing them as well. He has a number of stories published so he likes to believe he knows what he's talking about. Here he will go over the basic elements of a good story and teach you some tricks to engage your readers and keep them hooked!

ChangedEntities.Title: Fursuit Repair Cafe
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: Let's repair together!
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
Open seam, detached claw or frayed hem? No problem!
In this small workshop I will show a few tricks for self-repair and share
some materials and my experiences to help you repair fursuits.
ChangedEntities.Description:
Open seam, detached claw or frayed hem? No problem!
In this small workshop I will show a few tricks for self-repair and share
some materials and my experiences to help you repair fursuits.
If you don't have any specific thing to repair, we can look at important sewing
stitches and how to glue a claw in well so that you're prepared for any emergency.
Fursuiters are welcome, as well as other hobbyists!

ChangedEntities.Title: Being an artist in the age of social media
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: Opportunities and challenges
ChangedEntities.Abstract: Social media such as Instagram, Facebook, Tik Tok and Co. have fundamentally changed our society over the past two decades. We communicate more and more digitally, and so art has become a medium that is rarely admired in galleries, but on the screen of a mobile phone. Suddenly it is possible for artists of all kinds to reach an audience of millions from all over the world.
ChangedEntities.Description: Social media such as Instagram, Facebook, Tik Tok and Co. have fundamentally changed our society over the past two decades. We communicate more and more digitally, and so art has become a medium that is rarely admired in galleries, but on the screen of a mobile phone. Suddenly it is possible for artists of all kinds to reach an audience of millions from all over the world. This holds immense opportunities, but also poses challenges and dangers. In this panel, Jonas aka JoJoesArt talks about his experiences with “going viral”, coping with the pressure of expectations and overcoming “social media burnout”. Tips and tricks on how to increase your own reach are included.

ChangedEntities.Title: Paws on Fire
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: Seating
ChangedEntities.Abstract: Dance battle event. Fursuit and non-fursuit dancers will show off their amazing dancing skills in one-on-one battles.
ChangedEntities.Description: Dance battle event. Fursuit and non-fursuit dancers will show off their amazing dancing skills in one-on-one battles.

checkerboard pattern** ("The Rotunda"), and **go down**. We suggest taking the
staircase on port side (left). Then go straight through the (mostly glass) wall and
**keep going straight until you reach the far wall** and, with it, your
destination! Please ignore any sirens that might try to lure you off course.

As always, in case you have any trouble finding your destination, simply
follow your nose…

### Services ###

While the past few years of being in hiding (not to mention the relocation… or
the reparations for that raided village…) have forced us to take a step back,
we will still do our usual best to tend to your every wish! Below you can find
a short summary of what you can expect:

#### Blowers And Dryers ####

Breezes aplenty! Please take a seat or a stand in front of our blowers to cool
off. If it's crowded, please keep some distance and share the
breeze. Likewise, please don't jump in front of people already using them from
slightly further away. For outfits, please (only) use the dryers instead! The
long tables of pipes are for drying heads (short stubs) and handpaws (longer
sticks), while the airborne pipes in wooden construction are for drying
bodysuits. Try not to keep your stuff on there too long, as space is limited
and demand is high. Otherwise we might need to move your things for you!

#### Drinks And Snacks ####

Feel free to try several of our brews! (Sorry, but local laws prohibit
alcohol, so no rum.) Please just make sure you deposit your cup in one of the trashcans
after, ok? We also try to provide some sugary and salty snacks, so you can leave
with more energy than you entered with!

#### Helpers ####

Our trusty staff is always happy to help you out! Whether it's getting in or
out of suit, grabbing a drink (we know it can be tricky with claws or hooves),
or answering questions, please feel free to ask us and we'll do our best to
get you what you need!

### Rules ###

To avoid getting in trouble with the locals (again…), we're afraid we need to
be a bit strict about a few things. Always a few privateers ruining it for
everyone else, am I right? Here goes:

- **Fursuiters Only**

  You are allowed to take 1 assistant with you, but please make sure that our
  bouncers can see you are together. If you want to get into the lounge while
  not in suit, you will be asked to show your **fursuit badge** (not your
  con badge!) to enter. **Please don't forget to bring it, and do not leave it
  inside!**

- **No Glass Is Allowed In The Fursuit Lounge**

  People come here to stretch their legs, not to cut them open on shards!
  Please drink your rum elsewhere. Eye glasses, monocles and spyglasses are
  obviously excluded.

- **No Blocking Of The Backs Of Fans**

  We know this is a popular and effective way of drying your gloves and head
  cloths, but please consider that all sweat that is being extracted this way
  is now being blown straight into the faces of anyone sitting on the other
  side.

- **No Photo Or Video Recording**

  People come here to relax, not to be wary of anyone taking record of their
  salt-crusted faces. If you want to take pictures, go elsewhere. No
  exceptions.

Please don't argue with our staff if they ask you to follow these simple
rules. If you ignore any of these rules, we might be required to move your
things for you, and we will not be responsible for you finding them again.

### Mini Lounge ###

As always, there is a small lounge with some basic services (mostly blowers
and water), in case you're afraid you won't reach the big fursuit lounge
before you run aground. You can find it between the Rotunda and the hotel
lobby. We may not always be there to assist you, but you're free to use what
is available to you there. The same rules apply, though!

ChangedEntities.Title: Dealers' Den Closing
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: Dealers only!
ChangedEntities.Abstract: In the Dealers' Den artists and dealers from all over the world sell all kinds of furry-related art, prints, sketches, books, comics, t-shirts and all different kinds of merchandise for your daily furry life.
ChangedEntities.Description:
In the Dealers' Den artists and dealers from all over the world sell all kinds of furry-related art, prints, sketches, books, comics, t-shirts and all different kinds of merchandise for your daily furry life. They also offer various other goods like fursuit partials, fursuit accessories, home-made treats, jewelry or they may have scoured the Seven Seas for great books and comics to bring to Eurofurence. Meet your favorite artist or just roam around and gather some inspiration from everything on display here.

Please note that some artists offer theme-related or Eurofurence-exclusive goods that you may not be able to obtain anywhere else. At our Eurofurence Shop you can get old EF shirts and other leftover goodies. Missed a design? Ask what sizes are still in stock.

ChangedEntities.Title: Art Show Closing
ChangedEntities.Abstract: This year's Art Show once again features a multitude of international artists. Find your favorites, bid on whatever you like, and buy art for your home!
ChangedEntities.Description:
This year's Art Show once again features a multitude of international artists. Find your favorites, bid on whatever you like, and buy art for your home!

A separate registration is needed to obtain the bid stickers necessary for bidding.

You will get a final chance at bidding during the Art Show Closing. Here it will be determined who will make the final offer on a piece of art – or whether, perhaps, a contested piece goes to auction.

Important: the closing is a fast and decisive event. You will need to have bid stickers at hand to participate, so we can avoid crowding the show area with spectators. Bid stickers will only be available until 30 minutes before the closing. During the closing, we will not hand out new stickers, so make sure you have enough to place your final bids.

In the Art & Charity Auction, you will have to defend your selection of contested pieces against other prospective buyers. Please note that this year's auction starts earlier than in previous years.

Bids must be placed in Euro and paid in cash on site.

Look out for more information at the Art Show and read the bulletin boards for last-minute details!

ChangedEntities.Title: Fox Amoore presents Bandthro
ChangedEntities.Abstract: Come and enjoy over an hour of live music performed by furry musicians from all over the world. Featuring guest of honor Fox Amoore, Shadowwolfen, Rhubarb & Cosmik and many special guests. Come for the Rock, stay for the feels!
ChangedEntities.Description: Come and enjoy over an hour of live music performed by furry musicians from all over the world. Featuring guest of honor Fox Amoore, Shadowwolfen, Rhubarb & Cosmik and many special guests. Come for the Rock, stay for the feels!

ChangedEntities.Title: Fursuit Photoshoot Registration
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: Block 5
ChangedEntities.Abstract: Registration takes place at the ConOps Office (Estrel Hall B), first come, first served. Each block in the schedule has its own registration time; "Block 2" registration is only for "Block 2" openings! Once all slots for a block are taken, registration is closed again. So the "registration end time" is more of an "approximately up until" time. Due to the large demand for time slots, we prioritize people who didn't get a chance the year before. You can still apply, but you might get turned down.

ChangedEntities.Title: The Classic Cruise
ChangedEntities.Abstract: Listen to all the songs you love! Or the songs you hate! Doesn't matter because we know you're dancing to them anyways.
ChangedEntities.Description:
The Classic Cruise celebrates all kinds of music!
These tunes don't get old, they only get better cause you haven't heard them in a while.

These fine DJs are going to make you go back in time and there is nothing you can do about it.
Not that there is anything you would want to do about it.
We know exactly how crazy you folks are about this and so are we!

ChangedEntities.Title: Fur-E-Oke
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: Open End
ChangedEntities.Abstract: Sing your heart out to your favorite tunes, melt the hearts of the audience with your velvet voice, or rock their socks off! You decide!
ChangedEntities.Description:
Sing your heart out to your favorite tunes, melt the hearts of the audience with your velvet voice, or rock their socks off! You decide!

Open End!

ChangedEntities.Title: Why You Shouldn't Mix Wikihow and F-List Erotic Roleplay
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: True Stories of Lessons Learned
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
Long ago, I used an image from Wikihow as the
avatar for a character on F-List, because I didn't know how to draw and I needed
something for my profile image. The experience changed me. What happened next, and
what I learned from it, must be shared with the world. FUN IS GUARANTEED.
ChangedEntities.Description:
Long ago, I used an image from Wikihow as the
avatar for a character on F-List, because I didn't know how to draw and I needed
something for my profile image. The experience changed me. What happened next, and
what I learned from it, must be shared with the world. FUN IS GUARANTEED.
This is a panel where I will share a bizarre and entirely true
story about Wikihow, F-List, the furry fandom as a whole, learning from your
mistakes, and becoming a better, more authentic person.

ChangedEntities.Title: Inflatable Community Gathering
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
Interested in inflatable toys and everything that has to do with them?
Then this is the event for you!
ChangedEntities.Description:
Interested in inflatable toys and everything that has to do with them?
Then this is the event for you! The inflatable community gathering is
Eurofurence's annual meeting to bring the inflatable furry community
together, show toys, share experiences and nerd around about vinyl, air
pressure and lots of squeakiness! We got a room, we got some pumps and
we have way too much empty space! So bring some toys, fill that room and make new
friends!

Please note that this is a family-friendly gathering, open to everyone and
rated PG-13. Some inflatables are unique, expensive and impossible to
replace. So please remember to treat people and their toys with respect
and ask the owners for permission before touching or even riding these
toys. All toys are welcome as long as they are originals – no knock-offs!

ChangedEntities.Title: Artists' Lounge
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: Let's be creative together!
ChangedEntities.Abstract: Do you like spending your evening around other artists, drawing and chatting about techniques, supplies and other topics? Then this daily social event is just the right place for you to be creative and get to know each other!
ChangedEntities.Description:
Do you like spending your evening around other artists, drawing and chatting about techniques, supplies and other topics? Then this daily social event is just the right place for you to be creative and get to know each other!

Come sit together with other artists and watch, chat, and have a good time together while being productive on your convention commissions. This is the perfect opportunity to use your time effectively, get critiques and help on your work from peers or simply relax from your work day at the Dealers' Den or Artist Alley.

ChangedEntities.Title: International Snack Exchange
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: All the nom noms you could ever want!
ChangedEntities.Abstract: Share your favorite local snacks and sample the favorites of others.
ChangedEntities.Description: The International Snack Exchange is an annual event where furs from all over the world gather at Eurofurence to bring snacks from their home countries for fellow furs to try and get excited about. Lots of munching will ensue, and no fur will ever leave this event with an empty belly – but they will always leave with a broader horizon regarding the snacks of the world!

ChangedEntities.Title: Fursuit Lounge
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
Like every year, EF has a dedicated Fursuit Lounge, intended for fursuiters only. It's mostly used as a changing room, but also to take a short rest, rehydrate, dry/clean/brush fursuits, or simply have a chat with fellow fursuiters.

Please check the conbook for the rules!
ChangedEntities.Description:
Time to wash the (sea's?) salty water off your face? Come and disembark at the
Fursuit Lounge and freshen up a bit!

Like every year, we've set up a safe haven for fursuiters (and their stewards)
to stretch their sea legs, where they can cool down, drink something other
than grog, and have a quick chat with the people they might not have seen in a
while… probably because they were out on raids along the coast again. Haven't
been there before, or want to know what's changed? Let us talk you
through what you can expect!

### Locations ###

Since some of our regulars were a bit too rowdy and lit half the nearby town
on fire in a drunken stupor a while ago, we've sadly had to relocate slightly
further down the coast. While you will still find the small treasure stash,
the mini lounge, at the same location in the lobby (more on this later), you
will now find our main lounge further north in the **ECC ROOM (2 &) 3**!

From the Estrel hotel lobby, go north past the mini lounge, **past the
checkerboard pattern** ("The Rotunda"), and **go down**. We suggest taking the
staircase on port side (left). Then go straight through the (mostly glass) wall and
**keep going straight until you reach the far wall** and, with it, your
destination! Please ignore any sirens that might try to lure you off course.

As always, in case you have any trouble finding your destination, simply
follow your nose…

### Services ###

While the past few years of being in hiding (not to mention the relocation… or
the reparations for that raided village…) have forced us to take a step back,
we will still do our usual best to tend to your every wish! Below you can find
a short summary of what you can expect:

#### Blowers And Dryers ####

Breezes aplenty! Please take a seat or a stand in front of our blowers to cool
off. If it's crowded, please keep some distance and share the
breeze. Likewise, please don't jump in front of people already using them from
slightly further away. For outfits, please (only) use the dryers instead! The
long tables of pipes are for drying heads (short stubs) and handpaws (longer
sticks), while the airborne pipes in wooden construction are for drying
bodysuits. Try not to keep your stuff on there too long, as space is limited
and demand is high. Otherwise we might need to move your things for you!

#### Drinks And Snacks ####

Feel free to try several of our brews! (Sorry, but local laws prohibit
alcohol, so no rum.) Please just make sure you deposit your cup in one of the trashcans
after, ok? We also try to provide some sugary and salty snacks, so you can leave
with more energy than you entered with!

#### Helpers ####

Our trusty staff is always happy to help you out! Whether it's getting in or
out of suit, grabbing a drink (we know it can be tricky with claws or hooves),
or answering questions, please feel free to ask us and we'll do our best to
get you what you need!

### Rules ###

To avoid getting in trouble with the locals (again…), we're afraid we need to
be a bit strict about a few things. Always a few privateers ruining it for
everyone else, am I right? Here goes:

- **Fursuiters Only**

  You are allowed to take 1 assistant with you, but please make sure that our
  bouncers can see you are together. If you want to get into the lounge while
  not in suit, you will be asked to show your **fursuit badge** (not your
  con badge!) to enter. **Please don't forget to bring it, and do not leave it
  inside!**

- **No Glass Is Allowed In The Fursuit Lounge**

  People come here to stretch their legs, not to cut them open on shards!
  Please drink your rum elsewhere. Eye glasses, monocles and spyglasses are
  obviously excluded.

- **No Blocking Of The Backs Of Fans**

  We know this is a popular and effective way of drying your gloves and head
  cloths, but please consider that all sweat that is being extracted this way
  is now being blown straight into the faces of anyone sitting on the other
  side.

- **No Photo Or Video Recording**

  People come here to relax, not to be wary of anyone taking record of their
  salt-crusted faces. If you want to take pictures, go elsewhere. No
  exceptions.

Please don't argue with our staff if they ask you to follow these simple
rules. If you ignore any of these rules, we might be required to move your
things for you, and we will not be responsible for you finding them again.

### Mini Lounge ###

As always, there is a small lounge with some basic services (mostly blowers
and water), in case you're afraid you won't reach the big fursuit lounge
before you run aground. You can find it between the Rotunda and the hotel
lobby. We may not always be there to assist you, but you're free to use what
is available to you there. The same rules apply, though!

ChangedEntities.Title: Furry Tails Theater
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: Seating
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
Live performance theater? Fursuits? Song and dance? You can find it all (except the
singing) at the main stage! "Fish 'n' Ships" will take you to the legendary Food Wars of
Tortuga, where a lifelong feud between two cooks reaches its boiling point…
ChangedEntities.Description:
Have you ever wondered what our world would look like if piracy had never been outlawed? How
would we live and act in a universe where the "Arr!" never became part of "Atrocious"?
Think no more! Instead, come and experience what we've set in scene for you. Join us on
a wild ride and follow the epic battle of the chefs in the Furry Drama Company production:
"Fish 'n' Ships".

For the first time at Eurofurence, we're showing a full theater piece on the main stage,
complete with cute fursuits, fiery choreographies, brilliant humor, and of course, a food
war, conducted with weapons of wit, whey and Worcestershire sauce.

Fish 'n' Ships is a live performed theatre production and has been prepared by the Furry
Drama Company, a team of live performance enthusiasts directed by Tsuki and Martini.

A separate registration is needed to obtain the bid stickers necessary for bidding. 

You will get a final chance at bidding during the Art Show Closing. Here it will be determined who will make the final offer on a piece of art – or whether, perhaps, a contested piece goes to auction. 

Important: the closing is a fast and decisive event. You will need to have bid stickers at hand to participate, so we can avoid crowding the show area with spectators. Bid stickers will only be available until 30 minutes before the closing. During the closing, we will not hand out new stickers, so make sure you have enough to place your final bids.

In the Art & Charity Auction, you will have to defend your selection of contested pieces against other prospective buyers. Please note that this year's auction starts earlier than in previous years.

Bids must be placed in Euro and paid in cash on site.

Look out for more information at the Art Show and read the bulletin boards for last-minute details!

ChangedEntities.Title: Fursuit Photoshoot
