ChangedEntities.Title: Enlightenment on Health Topics with the Berliner Aids-Hilfe e.V.
ChangedEntities.Abstract: We're talking about sexually transmitted infections (STI for short) and it's not only about HIV and AIDS, it's about much more. Because it's important to be well informed about this topic, we invited the Berliner Aids-Hilfe e.V. to do their information work at Eurofurence.
ChangedEntities.Description: The topic is omnipresent in our society general, but also in the ever-growing furry fandom. It affects numerous people, directly or indirectly. The Berliner Aids-Hilfe e.V. have a dedicated room at the Estrel Hotel, but will also be present in the open hotel lobby and foyer area with an information desk. So don't hesitate to speak with them or visit their room if you wish for a more private conversation.

ChangedEntities.Title: Artist Alley
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
If you're an artist, but applying for the Dealers' Den never crossed your mind, then the Artist Alley might be just the right place for you! No application necessary — if there's an empty table, feel free to sit down and offer your services.

**Once you are done, please free up your table.**
ChangedEntities.Description:
You're an artist, but didn't get a table at the Dealers' Den or simply decided that it is not for you? Then the Artist Alley might be just the right place for you! No application necessary — just grab a table: "First come, first served." Whenever there's an empty table, feel free to sit down and offer your services with sketches, badges, prints and a smile.

**Once you're done** doing business or feel like you've got enough commissions to fill some time, **please free up your table**, as another artist might be interested in having a go as well. Please also make sure to check bulletins for updated information.  If you download the Eurofurence smartphone app, you can publish "come find me" announcements on our Telegram and Dealers' Den Twitter channels. There's only one downside: due to German law, **selling adult material in public areas is strictly forbidden**.

ChangedEntities.Title: Art Show Sales & Unsold Art Pickup
ChangedEntities.Abstract: This year's Art Show once again features a multitude of international artists. Find your favorites, bid on whatever you like, and buy art for your home!
ChangedEntities.Description:
After you have successfully acquired a piece of art, you can pick it up on Saturday during the Art Show Sales. 
**Cash only, please** – no plastic! We need to pay the artists! Accepted currency is **Euro**; we can't exchange dollars, pounds or any other currency. Art Show Sales will be the place to pick up your items from the Charity Auction as well. In addition, artists can pick up unsold items.

*See the Conbook pages xx-xx for details!*

**Look out for more information at the Art Show and read the bulletin boards for last-minute details!**

ChangedEntities.Title: A Private History of Campaigns that Failed
ChangedEntities.Abstract: Throughout history there have been many attempts at starting and maintaining conventions. While some have succeeded, many have had less than optimal success. And then there are those whose lack of success has become the stuff of legend. Here we will examine what happens when well-intentioned people (or, in some cases, less-than-well-intentioned people) get themselves in way over their heads and find out the hard way that it's not always as easy as it looks.

designed to bring together songwriters of all levels of experience. Get to
know your fellow songwriters, share songwriting tips and stories, and,
hopefully, come away with some new ideas that will help you become an even
better songwriter!

ChangedEntities.Title: Pawpet Show & Closing Ceremony
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: Seating
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
Honeyberry and Professor Blackwood are crossing the
great white plains of the arctic to follow "The Signal". Their only lead is a voice from
the distant past, an echo of a long forgotten civilization, invisible ghosts in the
blinding storms and bone-chilling nights.

ChangedEntities.Abstract: We will present interesting and fun statistics from the convention (including the charity total so far) and thank the people who made the convention happen, including staff and hotel. This is the official finale of the convention, something you don't want to miss!

ChangedEntities.Title: Dealers' Den Cleaning
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: Dealers only!
ChangedEntities.Abstract: In the Dealers' Den artists and dealers from all over the world sell all kinds of furry-related art, prints, sketches, books, comics, t-shirts and all different kinds of merchandise for your daily furry life.
ChangedEntities.Description:
In the Dealers' Den artists and dealers from all over the world sell all kinds of furry-related art, prints, sketches, books, comics, t-shirts and all different kinds of merchandise for your daily furry life. They also offer various other goods like fursuit partials, fursuit accessories, home-made treats, jewelry or they may have scoured the Seven Seas for great books and comics to bring to Eurofurence. Meet your favorite artist or just roam around and gather some inspiration from everything on display here.

Please note that some artists offer theme-related or Eurofurence-exclusive goods that you may not be able to obtain anywhere else. At our Eurofurence Shop you can get old EF shirts and other leftover goodies. Missed a design? Ask what sizes are still in stock.

the distant past, an echo of a long forgotten civilization, invisible ghosts in the
blinding storms and bone-chilling nights.

ChangedEntities.Title: Artist Alley
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: Breakdown
ChangedEntities.Abstract: **Tables will be torn down at this time. Artists and dealers must have cleared their tables beforehand!**
ChangedEntities.Description:
**Tables will be torn down at this time. Artists and dealers must have cleared their tables beforehand!**

You're an artist, but didn't get a table at the Dealers' Den or simply decided that it is not for you? Then the Artist Alley might be just the right place for you! No application necessary — just grab a table: "First come, first served." Whenever there's an empty table, feel free to sit down and offer your services with sketches, badges, prints and a smile.

**Once you're done** doing business or feel like you've got enough commissions to fill some time, **please free up your table**, as another artist might be interested in having a go as well. Please also make sure to check bulletins for updated information.  If you download the Eurofurence smartphone app, you can publish "come find me" announcements on our Telegram and Dealers' Den Twitter channels. There's only one downside: due to German law, **selling adult material in public areas is strictly forbidden**.

ChangedEntities.Title: Fursuit Lounge
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
Like every year, EF has a dedicated Fursuit Lounge, intended for fursuiters only. It's mostly used as a changing room, but also to take a short rest, rehydrate, dry/clean/brush fursuits, or simply have a chat with fellow fursuiters.

Please check the conbook for the rules!
ChangedEntities.Description:
Time to wash the (sea's?) salty water off your face? Come and disembark at the
Fursuit Lounge and freshen up a bit!

Like every year, we've set up a safe haven for fursuiters (and their stewards)
to stretch their sea legs, where they can cool down, drink something other
than grog, and have a quick chat with the people they might not have seen in a
while… probably because they were out on raids along the coast again. Haven't
been there before, or want to know what's changed? Let us talk you
through what you can expect!

### Locations ###

Since some of our regulars were a bit too rowdy and lit half the nearby town
on fire in a drunken stupor a while ago, we've sadly had to relocate slightly
further down the coast. While you will still find the small treasure stash,
the mini lounge, at the same location in the lobby (more on this later), you
will now find our main lounge further north in the **ECC ROOM (2 &) 3**!

From the Estrel hotel lobby, go north past the mini lounge, **past the
checkerboard pattern** ("The Rotunda"), and **go down**. We suggest taking the
staircase on port side (left). Then go straight through the (mostly glass) wall and
**keep going straight until you reach the far wall** and, with it, your
destination! Please ignore any sirens that might try to lure you off course.

As always, in case you have any trouble finding your destination, simply
follow your nose…

### Services ###

While the past few years of being in hiding (not to mention the relocation… or
the reparations for that raided village…) have forced us to take a step back,
we will still do our usual best to tend to your every wish! Below you can find
a short summary of what you can expect:

#### Blowers And Dryers ####

Breezes aplenty! Please take a seat or a stand in front of our blowers to cool
off. If it's crowded, please keep some distance and share the
breeze. Likewise, please don't jump in front of people already using them from
slightly further away. For outfits, please (only) use the dryers instead! The
long tables of pipes are for drying heads (short stubs) and handpaws (longer
sticks), while the airborne pipes in wooden construction are for drying
bodysuits. Try not to keep your stuff on there too long, as space is limited
and demand is high. Otherwise we might need to move your things for you!

#### Drinks And Snacks ####

Feel free to try several of our brews! (Sorry, but local laws prohibit
alcohol, so no rum.) Please just make sure you deposit your cup in one of the trashcans
after, ok? We also try to provide some sugary and salty snacks, so you can leave
with more energy than you entered with!

#### Helpers ####

Our trusty staff is always happy to help you out! Whether it's getting in or
out of suit, grabbing a drink (we know it can be tricky with claws or hooves),
or answering questions, please feel free to ask us and we'll do our best to
get you what you need!

### Rules ###

To avoid getting in trouble with the locals (again…), we're afraid we need to
be a bit strict about a few things. Always a few privateers ruining it for
everyone else, am I right? Here goes:

- **Fursuiters Only**

  You are allowed to take 1 assistant with you, but please make sure that our
  bouncers can see you are together. If you want to get into the lounge while
  not in suit, you will be asked to show your **fursuit badge** (not your
  con badge!) to enter. **Please don't forget to bring it, and do not leave it
  inside!**

- **No Glass Is Allowed In The Fursuit Lounge**

  People come here to stretch their legs, not to cut them open on shards!
  Please drink your rum elsewhere. Eye glasses, monocles and spyglasses are
  obviously excluded.

- **No Blocking Of The Backs Of Fans**

  We know this is a popular and effective way of drying your gloves and head
  cloths, but please consider that all sweat that is being extracted this way
  is now being blown straight into the faces of anyone sitting on the other
  side.

- **No Photo Or Video Recording**

  People come here to relax, not to be wary of anyone taking record of their
  salt-crusted faces. If you want to take pictures, go elsewhere. No
  exceptions.

Please don't argue with our staff if they ask you to follow these simple
rules. If you ignore any of these rules, we might be required to move your
things for you, and we will not be responsible for you finding them again.

### Mini Lounge ###

As always, there is a small lounge with some basic services (mostly blowers
and water), in case you're afraid you won't reach the big fursuit lounge
before you run aground. You can find it between the Rotunda and the hotel
lobby. We may not always be there to assist you, but you're free to use what
is available to you there. The same rules apply, though!

ChangedEntities.Title: Rock Your Tails Off!
ChangedEntities.Abstract: A Guitar Hero-Style event.
ChangedEntities.Description:
Come on over, grab a guitar or the drums and shred
some Guitar Hero and Rock Band-style songs with us! We're pushing the PA to the max.
This year's RYTO will also be a bit different: we are playing CloneHero in all its glory.
That means you can choose between classic 5-fret or the latest 6-fret guitars as well as
the drum set.

ChangedEntities.Title: Art Show Artists' Payout
ChangedEntities.Abstract: This year's Art Show once again features a multitude of international artists. Find your favorites, bid on whatever you like, and buy art for your home!
ChangedEntities.Description: Artists and agents, get your money for sold items!

ChangedEntities.Title: Artists' Lounge
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: Let's be creative together!
ChangedEntities.Abstract: Do you like spending your evening around other artists, drawing and chatting about techniques, supplies and other topics? Then this daily social event is just the right place for you to be creative and get to know each other!
ChangedEntities.Description:
Do you like spending your evening around other artists, drawing and chatting about techniques, supplies and other topics? Then this daily social event is just the right place for you to be creative and get to know each other!

Come sit together with other artists and watch, chat, and have a good time together while being productive on your convention commissions. This is the perfect opportunity to use your time effectively, get critiques and help on your work from peers or simply relax from your work day at the Dealers' Den or Artist Alley.

ChangedEntities.Title: PonyPlay Panel
ChangedEntities.Abstract: An informative session for people interested in ponyplay as a flavor of petplay.
ChangedEntities.Description:
Open space workshop for everyone interested in trying out some ponyplay related stuff and gear. 

The workshop itself will consist of two parts. The first (and quite short) part will be a theoretical introduction to ponyplay. The goal is to give everyone attending an idea about the diversity of playstyles and possibilities when doing ponyplay and to get everyone warmed up a bit. 

After that you will have the opportunity to try out different things yourself like pony dressage or trying out some pony gear you've always have been curious about. There will hopefully be plenty of time and opportunity for that. I'm not sure yet if I will be able to provide for cart pulling as well, due to the venue having less space available, but we'll try to make it available if we can.

Consider the whole atmosphere to be very open, friendly and casual.

Please don't dress up without prior approval – only the panelists will have the opportunity to do so. Security will make sure that no kink gear is worn outside of the panel room. For more information about being a panelist please contact @raymondfeesh.

ChangedEntities.Description: CANCELLED

ChangedEntities.Title: Brony Meet-Up
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: Fans of My Little Pony
ChangedEntities.Abstract: A meet-up for everybody interested in or fan of the show.
ChangedEntities.Description:
Meet other fans of My Little Pony, no matter if you are a "Friendship is Magic" enthusiast or
Generation 5 newcomer. Talk, discuss and share experiences with friends and new people.
Don't forget to bring your plushies.

ChangedEntities.Title: Fursuit Badge Pick-up and Printing
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
Pick up your pre-ordered fursuit badges or get new ones made on site for a small fee. Please remember to bring your fursuit's head for confirmation.

(Pre-ordered badges can also be picked up from the Security Office (as their opening hours allow) outside our service hours.)
ChangedEntities.Description:
Your personal fursuit badge is not only a nice souvenir for your character; it is also your
access key to enter the Fursuit Lounge when not wearing a fursuit. While you are in suit, you can always
enter the lounge. You do not need more than one badge, even if you have several suits.

Please make sure you already checked in at the Eurofurence Registration Desk before visiting the Fursuit Badge Desk during our service hours.
On Tuesday and Wednesday, our desk can be found just outside the room with the Registration Desk, in the entrance area to the Rotunda.
For the rest of the con, we'll be in Estrel Hall B, right next to Registration.

Since there have been cases in the past of people trying to get fursuit badges just to gain access to the fursuit lounge, we will have to ask you to bring the head of your fursuits along when you come to pick up your fursuit badges so we can compare them to the pictures on the badge.

If you pre-registered a fursuit badge, your first badge is free and you can use the fast lane for pickup. If you forgot to pre-register your badge in time, we can also produce your personal fursuit badge on site. For this service and all extra badges, we need to charge you a small fee of 2 Euro per badge.

### Service hours for pickup and printing

#### Entrance Rotunda

**Tuesday:** from when the Eurofurence Registration Desk opens – 19:00. Pickup only!
**Wednesday:** 12:00 – 18:00

#### Estrel Hall B

**Thursday:** 11:00 – 13:00 and 16:00 – 18:00
**Friday:** 11:00 – 14:00

Outside our own service hours you will also be able to pick up pre-ordered badges at the
Security Office (as their opening hours allow).

ChangedEntities.Title: Bad Fanfiction: The Movie
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
Should the tentacle monster have chainsaw arms and
fight Shredder? Absolutely! First, help us make a terrible fanfiction, where shouted
suggestions are encouraged, and typos become canon. Then, the bravest audience members
come forth to act out the script! Prizes for participation and enthusiasm.
ChangedEntities.Description:
A comedic live writing of a terrible fanfiction, with audience suggestions
encouraged! Then, the audience will have the chance to act out the horrendous script to
hilarious results.

ChangedEntities.Title: Erotica 101
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: Writing the Squishy Bits
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
Want to write a filthy fanfic, sordid story, or otherwise
erotic episode? This is the panel for you! Covering the basics of how to construct
better adult stories for your readers to enjoy and offering some strategies to
spice up those sex scenes. You'll also get the chance to try out the techniques
with several amusing exercises, so come prepared to write!

ChangedEntities.Title: After Dark Dealers' Den Setup
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: Dealers only!
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
Over 'ere, matey! You look like you might be in the market for something… special. Our artists and dealers here be sellin' only the finest goods ye won't find in that market down below.

Join us up in the rafters of ye olde After Dark Dealers' Den for some arts and crafts of the more exotic kind!
ChangedEntities.Description:
Some scoundrels call the After Dark Dealers' Den on the Eurofurence shady and even notorious, but they sure be wrong on both counts! Located high up in the crow's nest overlooking the regular Dealer's Den down below, they who set up shop here in our exclusive little safe haven are all honest traders and crafters.

Here you can find all the wares you may have been searching for in vain below. There (most likely) won't be any fancy home-made jam or little, handcrafted amulets to hang about ye scrawny necks. This be more the kind of place to go if you wish to… indulge your wild side, be it with something to hang your walls with and feast your hungry eyes on — or something that is more hands-on.

But, no matter what it is you've come for: be sure to keep your paws, claws, fingers and such where they belong and adhere to all the same rules that be law all around the main Dealers' Den, as well as aboard the entire Eurofurence and the town of Tortuga she's currently moored at, lest ye want Davy Jones sent after your soul in person!

Here you can find all the wares you may have been searching for in vain below. There (most likely) won't be any fancy home-made jam or little, handcrafted amulets to hang about ye scrawny necks. This be more the kind of place to go if you wish to… indulge your wild side, be it with something to hang your walls with and feast your hungry eyes on — or something that is more hands-on.

But, no matter what it is you've come for: be sure to keep your paws, claws, fingers and such where they belong and adhere to all the same rules that be law all around the main Dealers' Den, as well as aboard the entire Eurofurence and the town of Tortuga she's currently moored at, lest ye want Davy Jones sent after your soul in person!

ChangedEntities.Title: After Dark Dealers' Den Setup
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: Dealers only!
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
Over 'ere, matey! You look like you might be in the market for something… special. Our artists and dealers here be sellin' only the finest goods ye won't find in that market down below.

Join us up in the rafters of ye olde After Dark Dealers' Den for some arts and crafts of the more exotic kind!

ChangedEntities.Title: Plushie Collector's Panel
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
One simply cannot have enough plushies. Come on over, show us your
collection and see what others brought. Or if you're a walking plushie, come on over
and flop down :D

One simply cannot have enough plushies. Come on over, show us your
collection and see what others brought. Or if you're a walking plushie, come on over
and flop down :D
Fursuiters welcome and photos very much encouraged!

ChangedEntities.Title: Rubber & Gear 101
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
A presentation of best practices, describing experiences,
and answering questions for those curious!
ChangedEntities.Description:
A presentation of best practices, describing experiences,
and answering questions for those curious!

ChangedEntities.Title: VR-Furs Open Talk
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
In this open talk with guests and interviews, we will reflect on past and future virtual spaces and the philosophical implications of avatars, online rituals and virtual life.
Let's speak about how we furries can help to shape a free and happy virtual future!
ChangedEntities.Description:

ChangedEntities.Title: Ony, The Runaway Circus Bear: A Rock Opera
ChangedEntities.Abstract: Rhubarb The Bear is proud to present his tribute to his father Onesimus The Great, a famous performing acrobat who traveled the world with Ringmaster Philip Eamon's Dazzling Wondrous Unbelievable Traveling Circus. Featuring Rhubarb as Ony, Cosmik as Ringmaster Phil, Pepper Coyote as Dr. Lucas Quelle, Jumpy Squirrel as ex-lawyer Paul F. Tarsus, and more!
ChangedEntities.Description: Rhubarb The Bear is proud to present his tribute to his father Onesimus The Great, a famous performing acrobat who traveled the world with Ringmaster Philip Eamon's Dazzling Wondrous Unbelievable Traveling Circus. Featuring Rhubarb as Ony, Cosmik as Ringmaster Phil, Pepper Coyote as Dr. Lucas Quelle, Jumpy Squirrel as ex-lawyer Paul F. Tarsus, and more!

ChangedEntities.Title: Music 101 with Foxes & Guests
ChangedEntities.Abstract: Fox Amoore and Guests hold a panel discussing the world of music production. Learn to record, master and release a track and discover the latest that is available to aspiring composers.
ChangedEntities.Description:
Fox Amoore and Guests host a panel on the wonderful world of musical production. From aspiring hobbyists to professionals, come and join a conversation highlighting some of the latest in music technology, instruments and software that is available to us today.

We will cover several aspects of music including production and sequencing (Are you a Cubase nerd or a Protools... Pro?), first steps into learning an instrument, virtual instruments and their applications in recording, mixing and mastering, and even going about getting your music released onto physical media such as records, CDs and cassettes.

Come join to listen, share your insights and experiences... and let's all leave having taught something new to one another.

ChangedEntities.Title: Read & Greet
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: Readers' and writers' meet
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
Do you write stories, books or poems? This is your time
to shine – a place to read to us or discuss with us. Find other bookworms and share your
favorite stories.
ChangedEntities.Description:
Do you write stories, books or poems? This is your time
to shine – a place to read to us or discuss with us. Find other bookworms and share your
favorite stories.

ChangedEntities.Title: Motion Capture for Anthropomorphic Characters
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
Want to learn more about motion capture and try on a full-body mocap system to pilot an
anthro character? Come to our panel where we'll share our co-op's experience from the last
three years. A lecture about lessons learned, Q&A, and live lab exercises. Topics include
use of tools like Houdini, Unreal Engine, and TouchOSC, and hardware from Rokoko.
ChangedEntities.Description: If you’re interested in motion capture, live digital puppetry, or 3d character animation, this panel is for you! During this panel, Connor (aka Ruxbat!) will demonstrate the live motion capture workflow in use at our digital storytelling collective, Lycamthrope.com. Participants at the panel will have an opportunity to try on a motion capture suit, gloves, and face capture system, and pilot one of our characters (wear tight fitting clothes or UnderArmor, the suits are tight!). During this panel, we will tell the story of our queer artists co-op, and aim to inform an audience of 3d hobbyists, technical artists, and animators about the successes we’ve had and the failures we’ve learned from since 2019 as we’ve developed our craft. We’ll include plenty of time for Q&A and lab exercises to demonstrate how motion capture works with anthropomorphic characters. Topics include use of software tools like Houdini, Unreal Engine, and TouchOSC, motion capture hardware from Rokoko, and what we’ve learned from OptiTrack and Vicon about their optical solutions. We’ll also talk about virtual production and the HTC Vive.

ChangedEntities.Title: barq dev meetup
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
Creating an app for the furry fandom is not
always easy, but always (okay, almost always) fun! At the barq dev meetup you can
catch a glimpse of our adventure, sneak peek at the roadmap for next year, discuss
feature ideas and collect exclusive goodies!
ChangedEntities.Description:
Meet the developers of barq and hear exclusive stories about the
journey from 0 to 60.000 members. Learn about what it takes to create an app in
the global furry fandom and learn from our mistakes. There will be a
powerpoint with slides with big numbers on them. We will try to keep it fun for
everyone, but we cannot guarantee we won't talk about TypeScript, AWS and other
nerd stuff.

ChangedEntities.Title: Digimon Fans Meet & Greet
ChangedEntities.Abstract: Digimon fans talk about and discuss their favorite anime series.
ChangedEntities.Description:
A panel for fans of the series Digimon Adventure and their follow ups (Tamers etc.)
to discuss the series and get to know each other.
Have you seen a Renamon fursuit before? Would you like to? What is your favorite Dragon
Digimon and why?

ChangedEntities.Title: VR-Furs Meetup
ChangedEntities.Abstract: You play VRchat, Neos or anything VR? Come and meet all the other fellows! No phantom touch, it's real this time. Let's get to know each other accompanied by live DJ music.
ChangedEntities.Description: You play VRchat, Neos or anything VR? Come and meet all the other fellows! No phantom touch, it's real this time. Let's get to know each other accompanied by live DJ music.

ChangedEntities.Title: Fursuit Making Meet-Up with Mstisha
ChangedEntities.Abstract: Let's talk about building fursuits and all the topics that come with it, from different types of fur and fabrics to individual techniques and tricks!
ChangedEntities.Description:
Hello, my name is Mstisha and in this panel we will talk about fursuits!
What do they mean to you? How much work to do you invest in them? Are you building fursuits yourself and want to share your experiences with us? Or do you just want to hear about some life hacks from other fursuit makers?
Then welcome – this is **the** panel for you!

ChangedEntities.Title: My Journey in Self-Publication
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: Pros and Cons for New and Aspiring Writers
ChangedEntities.Abstract: As a new writer, unsure of whether to self-publish or go with a major publishing house, there are certain cons and pros to self-publication.
ChangedEntities.Description:
After self-publishing two books in my Legend of Ahya series with a third on
the way, I've learned the ups and downs of self-publication, including pitfalls to watch
out for and resources you can use to succeed in your own publication. I also will talk about doing a
major publication with an established publisher and reasons why I personally chose not to
go that route.

ChangedEntities.Title: How do I even commission art?!
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
Commissioning art from an artist can be a difficult experience - for the customer as well
as the artist.
This is a discussion panel about commissioning art, being commissioned, communication
issues, common mistakes and other experiences made along the way.
Everyone is invited to tell their stories.
ChangedEntities.Description:
Commissioning art from an artist can be a difficult experience - for the customer as well
as the artist.
In this discussion panel we want to talk about our adventures in commissioning art, being
commissioned, communication issues, common mistakes and other experiences we made along
the way.
Everyone is invited to tell their own stories about difficulties they encountered, what
they learned from it, and to give their pieces of advice to others.

ChangedEntities.Title: The Dutch Angel Dragon Meet
ChangedEntities.Abstract: A meet for everyone who has a, or is interest in Dutch Angel Dragons
ChangedEntities.Description:
Welcome to the official Dutch Angel Dragons meet. Under the guidance of Ambassadors Remix
and Thabo everyone who has a Dutch Angel Dragon (DAD) or is interested in these majestic
species, are welcome to meet and greet with each other, ask questions or just have a good
time amongst likeminded critters.

ChangedEntities.Title: Elysium Above RPG
ChangedEntities.Abstract: Discover Elysium Above, a Tactical RPG where you will lead your armies to protect your kingdom from its fate. Come try our demo and learn about the game and the team with our Level Designer Daigo.
ChangedEntities.Description: Discover Elysium Above, a Tactical RPG where you will lead your armies to protect your kingdom from its fate. Come try our demo and learn about the game and the team with our Level Designer Daigo.

ChangedEntities.Title: Fast Furry Friends
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
New to the fandom? New at EF? Or just wanna meet new people?
Fast furry friends is an easy fast way to meet new people. It's like speed dating,
but without the dating. You will have 5 minutes to have conversations with a
person before moving to the next. Please be aware most people speak English.
ChangedEntities.Description:

Fast furry friends is an easy fast way to meet new people. It's like speed dating,

person before moving to the next. Please be aware most people speak English.

ChangedEntities.Title: Amateur Radio / CB Radio / HAMRadio
ChangedEntities.Abstract: CQ furry CQ furry CQ furry DE DL5WN. Are you a furry and a HAM radio or CB-Radio operator? Or are you interested in amateur radio or radio engineering in general? Drop by and join us in a little meet & greet of those interested in Radio technique.
ChangedEntities.Description: You're interested in radio technique, are an active HAM Radio OP, or just enjoy listening to the shortwave radio at home during the night? You want to know what radio system is used to communicate at the EF? You want to get a ham license for years now, but have no idea where to start? Either way, you're welcome to join us at a brief meet up of furries, who are also 'radio obsessed', for an open discussion about all the above.

ChangedEntities.Title: Games Corner
ChangedEntities.SubTitle: Let's play!
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
Come by and play some board or card games with like-minded furs.
The room is open for everybody to host their games. If you want to search for interested people to play a game with, we suggest putting up lists with specific times so they can add their names and you don't miss each other.
ChangedEntities.Description:
Do you have a game that you always wanted to play but lacked other players? Come and bring it to the Games Corner! We provide a space for all sorts of board, card, roleplay or social games. Whether it be Magic: The Gathering, Warhammer 40k or Agricola. All are welcome. Don't have a game? No problem! Ask around and join in!
The room is open for everybody to host their games. If you'd like to arrange for others to join you for a game, we suggest putting up lists with specific times so they can add their names and you don't miss each other.

ChangedEntities.Title: Artist Alley
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
If you're an artist, but applying for the Dealers' Den never crossed your mind, then the Artist Alley might be just the right place for you! No application necessary — if there's an empty table, feel free to sit down and offer your services.

**Once you are done, please free up your table.**
ChangedEntities.Description:
You're an artist, but didn't get a table at the Dealers' Den or simply decided that it is not for you? Then the Artist Alley might be just the right place for you! No application necessary — just grab a table: "First come, first served." Whenever there's an empty table, feel free to sit down and offer your services with sketches, badges, prints and a smile.

**Once you're done** doing business or feel like you've got enough commissions to fill some time, **please free up your table**, as another artist might be interested in having a go as well. Please also make sure to check bulletins for updated information.  If you download the Eurofurence smartphone app, you can publish "come find me" announcements on our Telegram and Dealers' Den Twitter channels. There's only one downside: due to German law, **selling adult material in public areas is strictly forbidden**.

If you download the Eurofurence smartphone app, you can publish "come find me" announcements on our Telegram and Dealers' Den Twitter channels. There's only one downside: due to German law, **selling adult material in public areas is strictly forbidden**.

ChangedEntities.Title: The absolute basics of linear perspective
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
Linear perspective is a very powerful tool, which
creates almost perfect illusion of three-dimentional depth and distance in art, yet still
so many people don't know it, don't understand it, or use it inproperly, making a lot of
mistakes. In this panel you will learn, how to use this tool to your advantage,
focusing on theory, basics, tricks and examples. (with little help of simple
mathematics)
ChangedEntities.Description:
This panel will focus on basics of linear perspective in art and on
examples how to use it in drawing basic scenes like streets, buildings, interiors,
furniture and other characters in perspective. Unlike my previous panels about linear
perspective itself, i want to focus there more on the practical side of perspective and
less on its theory. I would like to present there very basic things about linear
perspective itself and basic operations in it (dividing, scaling, multiplying), show
relations between character, objects and the background and how put them together to make
an appealing picture, where everything fits to its own scale and size (which simply
requires setting/drawing a reference object/character/fixed length to compare all drawn
things to them).  Then i'd like to present how to draw basic sceneries in perspective
using all mentioned earlier knowledge like a simple street with buildings, a simple
interior with furniture of any kind and how to draw a background when a character is already drawn there. I might also present, how to draw sceneries
with multiple visible levels like inside of shopping mall or a scene seen from the top of
the bridge.

ChangedEntities.Title: Computer Vision for Furries
ChangedEntities.Abstract:
Interested in how a computer "sees" our world and how this can be interesting for
your fandom experience? We showcase two furry-flavoured projects using Computer
Vision, looking forward to a discussion with you on your feedback, suggestions,
and questions.
ChangedEntities.Description:
Interested in how a computer "sees" our world and how this can be interesting for
your fandom experience? We showcase two furry-flavoured projects using Computer
Vision, looking forward to a discussion with you on your feedback, suggestions,
and questions:

1) "I'm a ...": Some have already heard of the self proclaimed "Fur Con AI", which
proved to generate entertaining results for those who want a software to
(mis-)classify themselves, especially when fursuiting.
But what if we train a computer to actually detect Fursuits? Let's try building
something useful and help connecting photographers and Fursuiters after events!
Specifically: identifying and tagging Fursuiters in event media galleries! In a
first step, we attempted feeding an open source image segmentation model with a
small dataset of Fursuiter pictures. We will present the methods and software
used, show our evaluation results, and exchange ideas for a potential sustainable
public community cloud service.

2) Games, VR, GCI movies: Digitalization allows us to visualize characters and
worlds in ways previous generations could not imagine.
Yet the creation of high-quality digital assets ? especially animating digital
characters in a realistic and convincing manner ? requires equipment and budgets
that private consumers can hardly afford.
We will take a look at how state of the art computer vision technology and
robotics can assist in bringing digital characters to life using commodity
hardware and open source software.
Video-to-avatar motion transfer for custom animation sets for your sonas or
favorite characters, animated GIFS and Telegram stickers - just our two cents on
what to do with this.

ChangedEntities.Title: Website Team
ChangedEntities.Text:
Once the convention is over, all packed up and stored and many exhausted departments go into well earned hibernation for a few months, that’s when the Eurofurence website team powers up. Our mission is to make a website, and make it good. 

The way to that website is, of course, riddled with many time-consuming and complicated tasks. Over the course of just six months, our team of specialized designers, artists, writers, and programmers create a design based on the next con’s theme. The theme is reflected in all matters of the website: even function follows design. An artist is on board to create a visual art piece to first introduce the new theme to both public and staff. The team then updates and layouts all content, molding everything into code that follows the newest standards and will run on all combinations of screens, devices, operating systems and configurations possible. The website team ensures the EF website is accessible to all and breathes the spirit of the theme!

Once the website is done, we don’t exactly sit back and relax. Throughout the year we provide updates to the website as they come in, ensuring any and all information is always up to date.

Of course, we’re only human, so should we have missed anything or if you’re having any trouble accessing the website, feel free to drop us a note via web@eurofurence.org and we’ll get back to you!

ChangedEntities.Title: Summerboat
ChangedEntities.Text:
## About Summerboat

AN EXCLUSIVE BOAT PARTY DEPARTING FROM THE ESTREL
Summerbo.at: All Paw on Deck is an exclusive party on a large boat. From the Estrel dock to the Spree and back, through the German Capital, take in the sunset and mingle on the outdoor deck, retreat to the lounge and dancefloor with live DJs.

### Fursuits
Fursuits are very welcome onboard of our ship. Please keep in mind that space is limited. Do not bring all your suits if you do not plan on suiting in all of them. In the fursuitlounge we will provide water and fans for cooling down.

## Rules
You can find our rules on summerbo.at!
The terms and conditions of Eurofurence also apply during the party. 


## Timetable

### DJ Sets
* 19:00 @ Mayk Live DJ Set
* 20:15 @ Big Blue Fox Live DJ Set
* 21:30 @ Gorsh Live DJ Set


### Events
* 19:00 @ MS Alexander von Humboldt: Boarding!
* 19:00 --> 20:45 @ Outdoor Deck: Photos.
* 20:00 @ Sunset Group Photos
* 23:00 @ Return to Estrel
 

**What is Summerboat exactly?**
Summerboat is the one and only pre-party to start Eurofurence the right way! What started as a small plan to get some fursuiters, rent a boat and just enjoy Berlin from the water, has been grown from a boat to a ship, from a few fursuiters to almost 200 and over 300 attendees with DJ's and events.

**Our Team**
The team consists of 5 staff members and 7 wonderful crew members. Together we make sure that you can party hard and enjoy the night! Onboard we also have EF Security to make sure no fursuiters fall overboard and of course the team from Stern & Kreis to make sure the boat will float.

ChangedEntities.Title: Glympse Interactive Map
ChangedEntities.Text:
Watch other attendees travel towards Eurofurence (or back) through space and time!

All you'll need to participate is a smart phone and the Glympse app (available on Android, iOS and Windows Phone).

Simply start the app and set it up to share you location using "**!Eurofurence**" as a tag.

**Some Advice**

* If you don't want to share your home address, you might want to enable location sharing a bit after getting on your way to the con.
* Please mind battery load and the rather heavy energy consumption of GPS and Glympse. Make sure your battery is loaded, or others won't see you on the map!
* Although Glympse has a navigation feature, we suggest sticking to the navigation app you've grown used to.
* Please be aware that Glympse is a free third-party service on their own. You agree to their terms and conditions when sharing your location.
* You should be able to watch the **!Eurofurence** tagged map in the Glympse app. However, this seems to bug out sometimes - in such case, just let the app share your location in the background and watch the map on this website.
* In case of trouble, ... we cannot do anything for you. Sorry, but our entire staff is on their way to the con themselves! ;)

ChangedEntities.Title: How you can help
ChangedEntities.Text:
As in past years, we are seeking donations of artwork and other unique items to be used in raising money for charity through our Lottery Booth, Charity Auction and a Charity Display in the Art Show with items for silent bidding.

Even if you have not pre-registered your donation, we will still happily accept extra donations during the convention. You can also consider donating a percentage of your Art Show sales to charity.
There will be various events, activities and other opportunities to donate money during the convention to support our charity. 

The charity team and Cheetah Preservation Foundation thank you from the bottom of our hearts for anything you can spare.

ChangedEntities.Title: Artist Alley
ChangedEntities.Text:
You are an artist, but never thought about applying for the Dealers' Den? Then the Alley might be yours to start with. No applying, just catch a table: "First come, first served".

Whenever there is an empty table, feel free to sit down and offer your service with sketches, badges, prints and a smile. If you don't feel like it any more or got enough work to do to fill some time, another artist might be interested in the table. Please also check bulletins for updated information.

Only disadvantage: due to German law, **selling adult material in public areas is strictly forbidden.**

* **Opening times:** Wed 11:00 till Sat 18:00
* **Breakdown:** Sat: after 18:00

---

#### "Self-Promotion" / Table Registration ####

If you claimed a table in the Artist Alley, you can announce your presence on our official Telegram and Twitter feeds! If you wish to do this:

  1. Install Eurofurence Mobile App if you haven't done so yet. (If you're reading this within the app right now, you can obviously skip this step!)
  2. Login with your registration details.
  3. Tap on "**More**" in the menu/navigation bar.
  4. Tap on "**Services**".
  5. Tap on "**Artist Alley**", then on "**Table Registration**".
  6. Fill out the registration form and provide a picture (if you don't have one you can also just take one right on the spot!), and submit it. Done!

After being reviewed, your presence in the Artist Alley will be announced on our official Telegram channel, using the information and image you provided. If you claim a table again on any other day of the convention, you can easily just re-submit your last registration again for another signal boost!

ChangedEntities.Title: Paramedics
ChangedEntities.Text:
**Did you know?**

Eurofurence Security has a large crew of highly qualified and furry-friendly paramedics on-site at all times. They can take care of anything from a minor scratch to a life-threatening injury. They have been our resident crew for many years and have seen everything furries can do to themselves. Don't be shy, they are legally bound to discretion.

*Please note, that due to German law they are not allowed to hand out medication e.g. painkillers. Contact us if you need any medical support.*

ChangedEntities.Title: EF Prime
ChangedEntities.Text:
As always, we're here to provide you with the latest information on upcoming events, straight to your hotel room on **TV channel 1**. We'll even show you stage events live!

Even when the stage crew isn't ready for the next event yet, we'll have something for you: with many years of conventions behind us, there are plenty of highlights to show.

ChangedEntities.Title: Water Carriers
ChangedEntities.Text:
**Did you know?**

Some of our Security Crew members will be out and about, wearing blue high-visibility vests, hydration backpacks and handheld blo-
wers. These Water Carriers give out free water to fursuiting attendees - especially around major events. If you spot one, just wave at them to receive as much water as you'd like without the need to walk to the Headless Lounge or take off your head in public.

ChangedEntities.Title: Daily Eurofurence
ChangedEntities.Text:
The Daily Eurofurence is a printed newspaper covering events and stories about Eurofurence and the fandom in general. Four issues of the Daily (with four pages each) are printed during the convention, from Thursday to Sunday.

We are a team of about a dozen writers, photographers, layouters and cartoonists. Our goal is to both inform and entertain our readers. Our mission is to go to the most exciting events, talk to the most interesting people and ask the most pressing questions. Also, our best photos since Eurofurence 15 are collected in a permanent archive as a part of Eurofurence's "visual memory".

Daily contributors get to meet inspiring people and they get a glimpse behind the scenes of Europe's biggest furry convention. If you are interested in helping, or if you have ideas for articles, please contact our director Luxen.

We are always looking for writers, editors and photographers. From our team members we expect daily contributions (at least one article or photo job a day) and attendance of our morning meetings. Please be aware that most of the work (writing, editing and processing images) takes place in the evenings. The workload varies between two and six hours a day, but we promise to do our best to make sure that you can still enjoy the convention and that you don't miss your favourite events.  

We offer a friendly work atmosphere and good learning opportunities for both writers and photographers.

Skills we are looking for:

  * Good command of English
  * Some prior experience with writing or editing
  * Photographers should have a good command of their equipment and editing software
  * Curiosity and an open mind

Sounds good? Contact us (luxen@furry.ch or @eartufts on Twitter/Telegram) or simply visit our Daily EF office during the convention.

ChangedEntities.Title: Collect'em All!
ChangedEntities.Text:
Do you have what it takes to catch the most creatures at Eurofurence?

Participating is really easy, download the Eurofurence App and go to "Collect'em all". Enter the five digit codes you can find on fursuiter badges to catch them.The attendee with the most catches at the end of the convention will be getting a certifcate showing their collection prowess.

**Stop by the fursuit registration desk for any questions or if you want to register your fursuit for participation!**

ChangedEntities.Title: Group Photo
ChangedEntities.Text:
Where so many pirates are coming together, those who seek trouble for them are not far away. In order to not make it unnecessarily easy for the law-abiding and shining examples, we won't all gather in one place to have a group photo of us taken together.

Instead, we are going to make use of an entirely new tool. By taking the first socially distanced pirate group photo this side of the seven seas!

There will be a photo booth for taking photographs of yourself - and perhaps another pirate - which will be assembled into a large collage by our team after the convention! The booth will be operating during the entire time the convention is running, and after screening the pictures, you'll be able to get your very own photo as well. From now on, every pirate has the chance for a wonderful photo memorabilia. No matter the time or day.

ChangedEntities.Title: IT Team
ChangedEntities.Text:
A lot of hard-working, dedicated people make Eurofurence what it is: a great event full of creativity, color, fur, stage shows and inpromptu-fursuit artists. Behind the scenes, this requires a lot of planning, preparation, coordination and general "making the magic work". Thus there's barely a spot where IT systems don't play a role in the background. While, traditionally, each department builds and operates their own system tailored to their specific needs, more structure and knowledge has become vital over the years.

The Eurofurence IT department fills this role of a central coordinator and service team for every department that needs IT services before, during or after EF. Among those are the operation of the EF server, which hosts our website including the Daily EF archives, forums, a multitude of internal systems like wiki, etherpad, kanboard, otrs and so on. We help to coordinate the main registration system for EF, for fursuit badges, art show and dealers den. New systems are installed or custom-crafted for special purposes, like an electronic "stage rider" for stage events.

On-site we coordinate with the Estrel IT to get the internet connectivity working; for instance, this included last year's live-stream of our "big party" to the outside, running the IT infrastructure like DHCP/DNS, provide hardware (PCs, scanners, switches, etc.) for departments which don't have their own and run our staff wifi.

The most visible part for attendees is our very own "Eurofurence app". It's completely custom-built by us, with a high-performance cloud backend and native on iOS, Android and even Windows Phone. Close cooperation between departments is needed here to get all information from event programming, dealers enlistings, general information and more into the app.

Since our work is so specialized and diverse, we don't usually have open job postings. However, if you're good at IT maintenance, administration and especially programming and would like to help primarily outside the actual convention days, feel free to contact Zefiro. You might soon become part of a ninja team dedicated to keep things running. 

If you want to be a part of the IT team, contact Zefiro via mail or Telegram.

ChangedEntities.Title: Eurofurence on Social Media
ChangedEntities.Text:
You have a great time with old and new friends? You discovered a great food place nearby? You saw a stunning fursuit pose?

Whatever it is that makes EF unique and awesome for you, **please share your impressions** on Twitter using Hashtag **#ef26** so everyone can easily find them and enjoy as well!

ChangedEntities.Title: The Cheetah Preservation Foundation
ChangedEntities.Text:
The cheetah is the world's fastest land animal and they are dangerously close to extinction. Less than 7000 of the big cats remain in the wild. Dozens of species face extinction across the world, and many more are increasingly vulnerable and threatened.

The Cheetah Preservation Foundation (CPF) was founded in 1988, with the principal aim of ensuring the survival of the cheetah and other endangered species, as well as educating our visitors. Their mission: To promote and fund the conservation of cheetah and other endangered species through captive breeding, research and public awareness.

For 34 years the CPF has worked tirelessly for the conservation of these animals – they are one of the 5 biggest cheetah centres in the world and have for many years had the highest survival rate of cubs produced globally.

### Cango Wildlife Ranch

The Cheetah Preservation Foundation is a division of Cango Wildlife Ranch. CWR is one of the few facilities in South Africa to be accredited by PAAZA (Pan-African Association of Zoos and Aquaria) and WAZA (World Association of Zoos and Aquaria), showing their high standards of animal care and husbandry as well as their contributions to conservation.

### Dedicated work

The Cheetah Preservation Foundation (CPF) has crafted a unique program where their visitors have the opportunity to meet some of their ambassador animals. "It is our strong belief that when a person has a close educational experience with an animal, it instils a desire to protect the species and encourages a movement to be more mindful about the exploitation of their environment".

The conservation and education facility doesn't receive government funding, which is an enormous challenge with the overheads that they face. In addition to their mission, their primary focus is to ensure that all their animals receive the highest attainable standards of medical care and premium species specific diets. Their standards are exceptionally high and it all comes at a cost, as do the many hours of labour put in by our over 100 dedicated and animal loving staff.

### How our donations help

Especially during the pandemic, the CPF had a very hard time, lacking visitors and donations. All money we raise will make a huge difference for them and will be used for their various projects:

Expanding enclosures, feeding the animals and caring for them, veterinary costs, cold storage rooms (important), providing food for over 200 animals, donations to conservation programs and education.

You can also get a sponsorship for a certain animal – for more information and options, please ask our Charity: Carmen Ellis and Craig Gouws from the CPF will be present at the convention. You can meet them at the charity booth or attend one of their panels to learn more about the endangered beautiful big cats.

ChangedEntities.Title: Environmental badge
ChangedEntities.Text:
An environmental badge is obligatory for green zones in Germany - also for foreigners! Purchase your badge prior to your visit to Germany! Vehicles without environmental badge may not pass through the green zone, otherwise there is a fine of minimum 80 €. This is also valid for all vehicles registered in foreign countries, like cars, trucks, and busses, as well as for business travellers and for tourists. For this reason, it is recommended that all drivers inform themselves about the environmental badges, and purchase their badge on time. For further information, please contact the hotel or refer to the link below.

The hotel itself is just outside the green zone and can be accessed without an environmental badge. This however will prohibit you from entering the inner city, so take that into consideration when thinking about shopping and parking!

Links.Name: Information site of the Senate Department for Urban Development

ChangedEntities.Title: Fursuit Gameshow
ChangedEntities.Text:
The gameshow department is responsible for planning and operating the fursuit gameshow at EF. This involves finding new and revamped games for the suiters to play, building props, testing the games, communicating with the involved departments (programming, stage, security) to get all the locations and timeslots sorted out.

The main idea is to add the "show" to the "games". Most conventions only are doing "fursuit games", which is fun but usually only mildly entertaining to watch. We strive to add some interesting aspects to all games that we are putting on stage. The best ideas however sometimes fail in reality, even after trying them out several times. The show is a "one-off" kind of a deal, so we always expect some "issues" which require fast troubleshooting capabilities.

We are usually looking for helpers in the backstage area: moving props on and off stage, getting fursuiters ready for their cue and sometimes helping during a game - as spotters and/or "living props", depending on the game.

We are planning everything out way before the convention and need helpers who will be available online at least some weeks before EF so we can go through the show and games and everybody knows the props, games and can start to learn their cues. We don't get rehearsal time at EF!

If you are interested in helping out, please contact: Atkelar via fsgs@eurofurence.org.

ChangedEntities.Title: After Dark Dealers' Den
ChangedEntities.Text:
Some scoundrels call the After Dark Dealers' Den on the Eurofurence shady and even notorious, but they sure be wrong on both counts! Located high up in the crow's nest overlooking the regular Dealer's Den down below, they who set up shop here in our exclusive little safe haven are all honest traders and crafters.

Here you can find all the wares you may have been searching for in vain below. There (most likely) won't be any fancy home-made jam or little, handcrafted amulets to hang about ye scrawny necks. This be more the kind of place to go if you wish to… indulge your wild side, be it with something to hang your walls with and feast your hungry eyes on — or something that is more hands-on.

But, no matter what it is you've come for: be sure to keep your paws, claws, fingers and such where they belong and adhere to all the same rules that be law all around the main Dealers' Den, as well as aboard the entire Eurofurence and the town of Tortuga she's currently moored at, lest ye want Davy Jones sent after your soul in person!

**Dealer Setup:**

* Wednesday: 18:30 to 20:00
* Thursday: 10:00 to 12:00
* Friday: 11:00 to 12:00
* Saturday: 11:00 to 12:00

**Opening times:**

* Thursday & Friday: 12:00 to 13:00 (supersponsors only & all attendees with **special mobility needs**)
* Thursday & Friday: 13:00 to 14:00 (sponsors & supersponsors only & all attendees with **special mobility needs**)
* Thursday & Friday: 14:00 to 18:00 (regular)
* Saturday: 12:00 to 18:00 (regular)

**Dealer Teardown:**
* Saturday: 18:00 to 20:00

ChangedEntities.Title: Photography
ChangedEntities.Text:
The Eurofurence Photography department takes care of all official con photography that is directly related to the attendees:

* The fursuit photo shoot
* The fursuit group photo
* The regular group photo
* Any requested event documentation
* *New:* The media catalogue

Historically, the Daily-EF has their own photographers as well as several department internal photography that might be required. Our responsibilities are directly connected with the convention attendees and involve post-processing of the images we take after EF is over. Thus - by definition - pictures that are needed during the convention are not part of our responsibilities.

Our department consists of photographers and assistants.

The photographers:

* Share some hours per day on the photo shoot location, using rented equipment.
* Take turns covering various events for the media catalogue using their own camera (i.e. a halfway decent DSLR with RAW images is a must-have)

The assistants:

* Help some hours per day on the photo shoot location. This involves handling props, fursuiters and/or operating the registration system computer on location. There will be two assistants in parallel.
* If needed, help the photographers at other locations by holding up props, directing people or carrying equipment.

Both duties involve keeping to a schedule that will be discussed and up for fine tuning within the team as soon as the EF timetable is available, so usually nobody has to miss out on "must go" events.

The fursuit photo shoot might be amongst the more stressful tasks that EF has to offer, but the chance to meet lots of suiters up close and personal makes for a good reward. Also, we try to minimize the hours per day by using enough people to divide the workload.

If you are interested in helping out, contact Atkelar or ShortyDragon, using photo@eurofurence.org before the convention.

There are a few prerequisites for helping:

We might need a few helping hands during setup and tear down of the photo shoot location and the group photo spot that are able to carry some delicate equipment when directed to do so.

For actual team members...

...the photographers need to:

  * Have some studio experience (preferably also with fursuiters as subjects)
  * Have experience with fursuiters (either as spotters or themselves)
  * Be good at coming up with some funny ideas for poses
  * Be on time

...the assistants need to:

  * Have experience with fursuiters (either as spotters or themselves)
  * Preferably be good at coming up with some funny ideas for poses to help the photographer and suiter in case of a block
  * Be on time

ChangedEntities.Title: Art Show
ChangedEntities.Text:
**This year's Art Show again presents a multitude of international artists. See your favorites, bid on whatever you like, and buy art for your home!**

A separate registration is needed for bidding to get bid stickers.

You will have a final chance at bidding in the Art Show closing. Here it will be determined who will make the final offer on a piece of art - or whether, perhaps, a contested piece goes to auction.
**Important:** The closing is a fast and decisive event. You need to have bid stickers at hand to participate, so we can avoid crowding the show area with spectators. Bid stickers will only be available until 30 minutes before the closing. During the closing, we will not hand out new stickers, so make sure you have enough to place your final bids.

In the voice auction, you will have to defend your selection against other prospective buyers. Please note that this year's auction starts earlier than in previous years.

Bids must be placed in Euros, and paid in cash on site.

Look out for more information at the Art Show and read the bulletin boards for last-minute details!

**Setup times (artists only):**

* Wed: 16:00 to 22:00
* Thu: 10:00 to 12:00

**Opening times:**

* Thu: 12:00 to 20:00 (regular)
* Fri: 12:00 to 18:30 (regular)

**Closing:**

* Fri: 18:30 to 20:30

**Art & Charity auction**  (Main stage): 

* Sat: 11:00 to 13:30 (seating starts at 10:30)

**Art pickup:**  

* Sat: 14:00 to 17:00

**Artists' Payout**

* Sat: 22:00 - 01:00

ChangedEntities.Title: Our Security & Medic Crew
ChangedEntities.Text:
Your safety is important to Eurofurence, so our Security & Medic Crew is on duty for you 24 hours a day, throughout the entire convention. We provide qualified medical and security service to all attendees. If you need any help, have concerns, need assistance or simply have a question: do not hesitate to contact us! If you are more comfortable talking to a security operative or medic of a specific gender, just ask.

Please always report issues as soon as possible and not after the convention - we would rather reassure attendees in the case of a false alarm than miss incidents!

**How to recognize us**

All members of the Security Crew wear either a shirt or an armband with our official "Eurofurence Security" or "Convention Security" logos. Additionally, they have an official security badge on a blue lanyard reading "Eurofurence Security". Anyone without this combination is not a member of our crew.

Our security operatives roam the convention and are on stationary duty at many locations around the hotel, such as the Art Show or the Camp Fire and they will be glad to be there for you, being helpful furries themselves. They take their job seriously, not themselves!

*So don't be shy - come and say hi!*

ChangedEntities.Title: Press & Media Relations
ChangedEntities.Text:
**A little introduction**

The media industry is changing fast. Digital technology has dramatically reshaped the news and media industries in the past decade. The growth of social networks, the introduction of smartphones and the evolution of online advertising, have contributed to a brand new media landscape that is changing more and more every day. The internet has not only changed the methods and purpose of journalism, but also people's perceptions of news media. Firstly, the rise of bloggers and user-based journalism has become immensely popular among both new and old media companies, a change that has drastically altered the definition of a journalist. Secondly, the linked nature of the internet has given rise to content collectors like Google news or The Huffington Post that no longer rely on individual journalists to provide news, but instead depend on their ability to gather and collect information into a single place where users can access it. Together they are changing society's traditional ideas regarding journalists and news.


**What about us?**

A lot of people at conventions don't want to talk to the press. But we can't just shut our doors. So that's where our team comes in. As a press and media relations volunteer for EF you represent the work of a huge convention, acting as a contact point for members of the press and other media representatives. We want to provide journalists with accurate information and give them a realistic look at our community. The press isn't good or bad; it's just the press. We just have to make sure they get right picture and the right story. 
When you are part of the media relations team it is important to remember that you represent a whole community. This means that we got a lot of responsibilities. You need to be prepared for the fact that anything you say to a journalist could end up in print or on a website the following day. 
The job requires you to be flexible, friendly and patient. Sometimes there's nothing to do, sometimes all journalists arrive at the same time. The job can be stressful so you must be able to work under pressure. The cool thing about working at press relations is that you are also able to show your side of the story. You can influence how the convention looks to the outside world. Also you're part of a great team full of passionate people. 

**Skills**

Press and media relations team members are:

  * Flexible
  * Patient
  * Enthusiastic
  * Friendly and approachable

Job requirements:

  * Communication skills
  * Knows how to deal with criticism
  * The ability to work under pressure
  * Passion for our community
  * Speaking and understanding the German and English language

If you want to help us, then come to the press & media reception at the convention or write an email to media@eurofurence.org.


**FAQ: How to cooperate with journalists?**

*How much time do journalists have?*  
Journalists are busy people. They are not here for fun, they are working. They have one goal in mind and that is to write a good story. 

*How should I greet the journalists?*  
First impression is everything. Greet them, talk to them and make them feel welcome. Even if you don't like journalists you should always treat them with respect. They're human beings just like you and me. 

*Are there rules the journalist must follow?*  
Yes! Before you show a journalist around make sure they are well informed about what they can and what they can't do. They should always first register at the media desk. Here they can get a media badge and the necessary information.

*What if they say something that is not true?*  
Don't get angry. Even if they ask difficult questions, you should stay positive. It can be really frustrating when reporters give you the feeling they don't take you seriously, or if their information is inaccurate. But getting angry only makes it worse. 

*But what story should I tell them?*  
Keep it simple. Most of the time journalists are not interested in all the details you want to tell. Stick to a straight and simple story. There is also a press-release featuring all kinds of background information which journalists can read in their own time if they're interested. 

*Any tips for when they ask me questions?*  
Make it personal. When you are guiding a journalist they will ask you a lot of questions. Some of them may be difficult to answer. If this happens and you don't know what to answer just make it personal. Tell your own version of how you see things.  
Be polite! Even if they aren't. The best advice is to help journalists as much as possible by giving them (where reasonable) what they ask for. Ensure that your information is relevant to them and provides a good read!

*But what if they ask me difficult questions?*  
Again, just stick to your original plan and keep it to yourself. Don't argue with them because it often makes things worse because most of the time you accidentialy confirm stories you don't want to confirm. In the worst scenario you can always just ignore the question.  
Bear in mind, journalists are good at making out they have the entire story already.
